campaign.story:
cover by Tim Gaedke!
You have priority!
Thank you for stopping by the Kickstarter for our Zine- ON THE STACK! 
Originally envisioned as a few short sequential comic stories, we quickly realized that there are so many unique artists that express a love for this great game through their creations. We knew that we had to invite some more players. Magic is as much about the game as it is about self expression and we found so many interesting and unique characters for our tribe of creators. Now we have a 20 page powerhouse tribute to MTG, including interviews, prose, sequential comics and more! 
Full color with B/W comics- 5.5x8.5 inch "mini-comic" sized book. 
See who is in our playgroup below!

Back cover- art by Harry Moyer
Creative Team!

First, untap with our Amazing cover by Tim Gaedke (above)
Harry Moyer and Jon Westhoff- this long-time comics team will bring you an awesome comics tale of mechanics gone by.
Zabracus Cosplay- sits down with our editor to talk about her experience with cosplay and streaming MTG arena. Including a photograph of one of her most iconic cosplays.
Timothy and Jon O'Briant- the brotherly duo sling you a comic spell you are sure to let resolve.
Austin Shyu- We were able to photograph an amazing handcrafted paper art figure form Austin for the Zine. His first MTG inspired piece!
Brad and Wesley Sun- yet another brotherly team-up, this time exploring Wesley's experience with MTG Cube in a prose and illustrated tale.
Meghan Burden- answers some question on her work as an alterist/proxy artist AND provides our readers with examples of her work, You can cut these FULL-COLOR proxies out of the book and sleeve them up!!
Zabracus Cosplay (not photo from book)
Examples of Austin's amazing work!
Proxy by Meghan Burden (may not appear in book)
from "Timmies and Johnnies" by Timothy and Jonathan O'briant
Rewards!
Tokens by Jon
Token by Harry
Tokens by Harry or Jon!!
Extra Books!
Crack-a-pack! Get some cards!

BONUS HARRY BOOKS
Caperbet- an Magazine-sized crime caper from Harry Moyer and Jon Westhoff.
Saltlick- a double dose of short mini-comics from Harry. 
so many sizes!
 STRETCH GOALS
We understand, books can be expensive and kickstarter costs add up, so we want to add some incentive to get you to ante up. Just as in MTG, in comics, you make friends. We have some awesome peers, who want to add to your draft value!
Friends!
Stretch goal 1- $2001
As soon as
 we fund, there will be some excellent DIGITAL PDF books added to your rewards. 3 free fantasy books for free!  
Modern Testament- Writer Frank Martin and his talented crew of creators are offering up their modern fantasy anthology for our backers!
The Servant- Jason Ford and Felipe Anguiano have provided us with a bonus for you all, issue one of the long-running fantasy adventure of four brothers, The Sevant!
From the Inside- Jason Ford with his brother James, has also provided an illustrated dungeon module for you RPG fans!

Stretch goal 2- $2250 or 250 backer
Reach either of these goals(and funded) and we will design a custom token to include with all physical tiers!

Stretch goal 3- ????




 OTHER STUFF!
Add COASTERS to any tier!
We are keeping it streamlined, but we have are packing a lot in this book!
Part-Time Comix coasters!
CPS!
If you missed our other 2021 release- CHILD POSSESSION SERVICES- you can get that, as well!
"Connie is a social worker by day. She has clients to see and tedious paperwork to never be caught up on. She also has a special talent and advanced training in removing and preventing demonic possessions in children. That's also during the day.
It's at the same job. Connie Dhar is burnt out and not just because she works in social services. The heat at her day job is only getting worse as incidents become more intense and her personal life goes to hell."
44 page Giant-sized one-shot issue!
 Money.dek
Why Kickstarter? With the second release from Part-Time Comix, we are continuing our mission of paying our contributors for their hard work. So, with contributor pay and printing costs, we could use some support form the comics and M:TG community to get the book printed.
Estimate Printing and shipping- $500
Contributor pay- $700 
Estimate shipping and handling for this KS- $450
Rewards- $100-$150
Kickstarter fees- 10% of total

Excess funds, after fees and shipping, will be utilized to get our contributors some extra copies to sell or hand out.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The books is 90% complete and we foresee no major risks to backing
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

You did it!
We thank you for every back, share or any kind of support. We could not have done it without you.
Thank you thank you thank you!!!!

updates.update_userinfo: Week Two! New tiers, surprise surge! ON THE STACK is back in the battle!

updates.update_content:
Great 1st week! 
Thank you all for a great week one, The biggest challenge for a small press company are these middle days. You all have done so much to assist us in our goal and if you can share you excitement, we can get you some great stretch goals, like 3 free books! 
So share on your social media or with a friend, add some sweet coasters, and we can get this funded!

Thank you!!
Thank you to our first supporters! We know this is a niche of a niche book, but we are so happy people are as excited as we are. It will take some time, but no one wants the game to end on turn one anyway :) 
The book is 90% done, it is just a matter of getting it in print and to you all.

campaign.story:
Fully funded - in just one hour! - this campaign has raised over $100,000 and will be bringing you 'ENCORE: GOLD - The Art of Liam Sharp.' The first of a proposed comprehensive trilogy ('SILVER' and 'BRONZE') of art books, featuring a huge selection of work from over thirty five years in the comics industry by artist and writer Liam Sharp. Backers will also receive an all-new creator-owned 25 page comic, 'The Chronicles of Lib LaRoche', written and lavishly illustrated by Liam, completely free! And on top of that they'll receive an exclusive collectable card from a planned Tarot deck used in the Lib LaRoche universe.

ENCORE: GOLD features an incredible introduction by legendary writer Grant Morrison, a creator profile by renowned journalist and interviewer Geoff Boucher, and is a showcase of some of Liam's all-time favorite pieces.
ENCORE: GOLD - THE ART OF LIAM SHARP
ENCORE: The Art of Liam Sharp hardback cover mock-up
BIOG
Liam recently wrapped his ground-breaking and acclaimed epic 24 issue run on DC's The Green Lantern with Grant Morrison, and is currently working on Batman: Reptilian with superstar writer Garth Ennis. But before that, and before his award-winning six issue limited series 'The Brave and The Bold: Batman and Wonder Woman' (which he also wrote) and before the wildly successful 'Wonder Woman: Rebirth' with fan-favorite writer Greg Rucka, Liam had a long and distinguished career as an artist and also a writer of both comics and prose fiction. He has also been a well-regarded boutique publisher, co-founding both the Mam Tor imprint and the ground-breaking digital company Madefire. 
Liam has worked for Marvel, DC,Vertigo, Wildstorm, Image, Darkhorse, Fleetway and Dynamite, producing a huge range of eclectic work in every imaginable genre. Encore - The Art of Liam Sharp  is intended to celebrate this long, creatively restless and innovative career, and will be a must-have book for collectors, fans and new-comers alike. As Grant Morrison writes in his introduction -

'Knowing the standards (Liam) sets for himself, witnessing first-hand the constant striving for new goals, new achievements, I’d hazard a guess he has barely begun the latest phase of his artistic journey, is only now stretching his peacock wings as we his audience are invited to sit back and applaud the dazzling display…'
ENCORE: The Art of Liam Sharp book with dust jacket mock-up
ABOUT THE BOOK
Available with or without the Conan dust jacket, ENCORE 'GOLD' showcases work from across Liam's extensive career, presenting much of the hyper-detailed art in it's black and white unlettered form for the first time in print - from the spectacular high fantasy of THE BRAVE AND THE BOLD: BATMAN AND WONDER WOMAN, to the incredibly intricate sci-fi realms of THE GREEN LANTERN. 
Within these pages you will also find many examples of Liam's full-color work - both traditional and digital - which pays homage to the masters of the past whilst also pushing boundaries and breaking new ground in the industry.
The cover to Liam's 'THE BRAVE AND THE BOLD: BATMAN AND WONDER WOMAN' series. Colors here by Romulo Fajardo JR.
Catwoman Cover
'MOULDERING STONES' featuring Red Sonja. A personal piece that ended up being a cover for Dynamite Comics.
Judges Dredd, Death and Anderson from a poster produced for a feature on the artist in the Megazine.
Promotional art for Liam's Manthing series with writer J.M.DeMatteis for Marvel - a favourite series for both creators
EASTER EGGS!
The book also promises to contain a host of un-lockable Easter Eggs, linking to (amongst other things) a film shot by Liam's son, Lorcan, where he talks about his career, techniques and life-lessons. 
 There will also be a unique opportunity to receive one of Liam's huge (18" x 24") original black and white pages (see below) from his iconic Green Lantern run with Grant Morrison for the first person to break a hidden code within the pages! 
Season 1, page 10, issue 10 of THE GREEN LANTERN - unlock the code hidden in the pages of ENCORE 'GOLD' to win this page!
ABOUT THE COMIC
As the first stretch goal was unlocked, along with the book backers will now receive a free 25 page comic, featuring all-new material, and telling the origin of Liam's character Lib LaRoche - a gothic female Conan in a new-weird world of sci-fi and fantasy elements (previewed below!) 
Lib LaRoche: Jubileumboek preview art
Page from Lib LaRoche - placeholder lettering only
Lib LaRoche sample page - placeholder lettering only
OFFERS
ENCORE 'GOLD' comes with multiple options:
PDF only
Without dust jacket
With Conan dust jacket
Dust jacket and signature only
Dust jacket, signature and remark
Dust jacket, signature and exclusive bookplate 
Dust jacket, signature with remark and exclusive bookplate
Dust jacket, signature, exclusive bookplate, original head sketch (3 options) 
Dust jacket, signature, exclusive bookplate, original torso sketch (3 options) 
50% off for retail orders of 10X basic hardback and dust jacket edition
Examples of previous torso sketches by the artist.
FUTURE VOLUMES 
ENCORE 'GOLD' 'SILVER' & 'BRONZE' box set mock-up
ENCORE 'SILVER", the second volume, will be a celebration of the intricacy of pure black and white comic art.
ENCORE 'BRONZE", the final volume, will feature a complete retrospective of Liam's career, from assisting the great Don Lawrence, through 2000ad, Marvel, Image, DC, and beyond. Over a series of interviews Liam talks to writer and teacher Dave Gillette about the trials and tribulations, good times and bad, and about the masters of the past that inspired him, and the artistic heroes that eventually became his friends. For comic historians it promises to be a goldmine, for aspiring artists there'll be a chance to hear first hand what it is like having a long career in comics and the visual arts.
'SILVER' & 'BRONZE' are slated for publication late 2021 and 2022 respectively. 
The slip case will be available for purchase with the third and final volume.

BOOK SPECIFICATIONS
ENCORE - THE ART OF LIAM SHARP 'GOLD"
Hardback with optional dust jacket
144 pages
7.5" x 11"
FIRST STRETCH GOAL UNLOCKED!
Now everybody who buys ENCORE:GOLD also gets the first ever 25 page Lib LaRoche comic free with the book, and what's more it will be signed by artist/author Liam Sharp!
Lib LaRoche comic #0 cover mock-up - not final art.
SECOND STRETCH GOAL UNLOCKED!
Now included with the book and comic will be one of a set of six cards, of increasing rarity! Five of them will be picture cards from the world of Lib LaRoche. The sixth will be a simple gold design with a QR code on it that will gift the owner something completely unique! 
Only FIVE of the GOLDEN CARDS will be sent randomly into the world with the books, for you to discover!
Mock-up of the Lib LaRoche card set
A brand new set will also be available with both ENCORE:SILVER and ENCORE:BRONZE.
Huge thanks, as always, from Liam and all of us in Team Sharpy! 
TS
FINAL STRETCH GOAL UNLOCKED!
After asking around we decided on the final stretch goal, and it's going to be a great one for everybody who has backed this campaign. 
Ultimately the free comic is fun, and the cards will be collectable and beautiful (more on that shortly!) but those things often get lost over time, and what's left is the book.
So with that in mind -
THE BOOK
Having hit $110K the book will have a page-holder ribbon, an embossed cover, and the dust jacket will have an added metallic ink. It already has heavy, high-end paper of the finest quality, and will be stitched and not glued. It will truly be a beautiful product!
THANK YOU ALL so much for the incredible support!!!

But also-

UPDATE ON THE CARDS
What I didn't say before, and what you are now just learning, is that Lib LaRoche uses cards as part of her character trait - no spoilers! There will only be two hundred copies only of each of the first five cards that will have a gold surround. So everybody who buys this book will automatically get one rare collectable card that will never be reproduced with the gold border again! ENCORE:SILVER will do five more new cards in silver, and ENCORE:BRONZE another five in (you guessed it!) bronze.
After that we are planning to create a deck of cards, the tarot set of Lib's realm, that can be used as regular tarot cards, or traded. These will feature the same cards that come with the three books, but without the gold, silver and bronze surround.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As most of the art already exists and the majority of the book has already been compiled, there is very little that could delay the production of the book(s), baring production issues, and the unforeseeable happening to Liam that might prevent him completing the all-new content promised. 
At the very least there are already five original unpublished pages, and the book can be filled out with other material from his career in the event of an accident or illness. However we are confident you will get everything promised in a timely, professional manner!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Last update and thank you of the campaign!
updates.update_content:
True story - me and my wife, Christina, once jumped up and down in our hotel room in Germany because we had made around 3,000 pounds selling some artwork at a convention. That was amazing to us at the time - it doesn't even seem that long ago, but it was the late 90's I believe. We have never been materialistic having both come from humble backgrounds, but that was enough to make a difference then, and it still would be now. So you can imagine how we're feeling as this astonishing campaign draws to its conclusion.
In about half an hour I'm going to close my browser for the first time in just over a month, put on some music, and do some art (I still have deadlines!) and try not to think about the flutter of my heartbeat and the well of excitement and happiness in my belly. I'm looking forward to that!

Any collectors should note that typically quite a few people pull out of any campaign at the last minute, which means that often some of the harder-to-get items are freed up again. So with just four hours to go I'm asking anybody who is thinking of pulling out to do it soon so others get a chance to buy them, and I get a chance to let people know what's available. :-)
Many thanks!
I can't believe this campaign is almost over! It has been my honor to correspond with you, and I very much look forward to delivering to you a truly beautiful item. I will, of course, continue to update you on our progress after this time period ends.

updates.update_userinfo: IT's TIME TO TELL YOU MORE...
updates.update_content:
I had been holding off on this because I wasn't 100% sure if it was the right time to go all in on something I've been working on for many years in one form or another. It's my ultimate dream project, and it all starts in the free comic you'll all be getting. This will be the biggest, most ambitious piece of world-building I have ever attempted in comic form, spanning centuries, and crossing lightyears.
Lib LaRoche is just one of two characters who's lives will interconnect across time and space. It will also encompass every genre I have ever loved, and an array of techniques to rival my work on The Green Lantern. It is a story that will take me years to tell, and I feel it's time to seize the moment and get it started!
And just when you think it can't get any better... :-)

Dear all -
Whatever you are doing keep doing it! Thanks a million for making these last 48 hours count! I thought we'd hit the glass ceiling a while ago. I'm VERY happy to be wrong again! :-)
ONWARDS!!!!!
Lx

Dear all -
I thought, as we're in the last few days and hours, that I would share Grant's astonishing introduction in full. I confess that both myself and Christina got misty-eyed when I read it to her the day it came in. It was off the back of our 24 issue Green Lantern run, which both of us had loved doing. It connected us in profound ways as it took on a life of its own. I've never done anything like that series before, and it was a joy to be able to celebrate not just the character, but the medium of comics itself. I don't think there's ever been a book quite like it.

Dear all -
Just 3 days left. What an incredible month! Amazing. (I definitely had a beer too many while celebrating at Mike Hess Brewing last night...) We're so grateful to everybody who has backed this! It's at least 4X what we hoped for. Wonderful madness!
My son said this is the point where we should go for broke in these final days, but I'm absolutely shattered! And really don't know what else I can do without tipping over the scales from delighted enthusiasm to just annoyingly insistent! So I'll probably be keeping it quite low key.

project_data.project_name: ENCORE: GOLD - THE ART OF LIAM SHARP

campaign.story:
BIG PROGRESSIVE IDEAS AND GORGEOUS, GONZO, GENRE COMICS
I'm Aubrey Sitterson and if you read my previous Kickstarted comic – Tyrell Cannon and my instant classic BEEF BROS – you know what I'm all about: Joining forces with the best artists around to use outrageous, bombastic concepts to explore and ruminate on world-changing, community-based ideas. That's why, when Chris Moreno (Zombie Dickheads, World War Hulk: Front Line) decided to follow up our beloved The Comic Book Story of Professional Wrestling, we developed Stoned Master, a blend of stoner comedy, kung fu action, and sun-drenched Los Angeles vibes chockablock with anti-gentrification rumination.
Stoned Master #1 is a 32-page, full-color comic book, the first of a planned five-part series cocreated by Chris and me, with letters by Taylor Esposito and logo by Tim Daniel. You can find out more below, but first and foremost…CHECK OUT HOW DOPE THIS THING LOOKS!
THC chocolate in your peanut butter
Blazed Fist vs Drunken Fist
Welcome to Chavez Heights
Honestly: What's better than this?
 Keep on scrolling to check out our rewards, including stickers, prints,  and original art and commissions by Chris!
GIMME THOSE DEETZ
Stoned Master is set in the fictional Los Angeles neighborhood of Chavez Heights, where the rapacious conglomerate RepCor is corporatizing and gentrifying everything in sight. And the only ones standing in their way? Burnout kung fu savant Frankie Wong, his drunken master, and his pals from the local cannabis dispensary. 
Imagine Kung Fu Hustle meets Pineapple Express. Or, for the old heads, Drunken Master meets Cheech & Chong. It's all the intense, artful fight scenes you expect from a martial arts epic, combined with gut-busting stoner comedy laughs, then fully baked in the Southern California sun.
While working together on The Comic Book Story of Professional Wrestling, Chris and I found ourselves jonesing for an opportunity to cut loose, free of the restrictions that come with nonfiction work. We wanted space and freedom for big, intense, outlandish action and hilarious visual comedy.
Stoned Master is our opportunity to show off, demonstrating all our strengths on a truly gonzo comic, all in service of actual good politics. With your help, we're going to make it happen, with any additional money raised spent how it rightfully should be: Paying the team more.
CHARACTER DESIGNS
As part of his efforts to make Stoned Master's Chavez Heights setting feel real, authentic, and lived in, Chris put in a ton of design work, creating characters that feel unique and visually distinct while remaining authentic and familiar.
REWARDS!
Slap it on your bong
Dare you to hang it up at work
Sample Chris Moreno commission
Sample Chris Moreno commission
WHAT IF YOU RAISE MORE MONEY?
$25,000: Everybody gets raises
In order to make Stoned Master happen, everyone's agreed to a lower rate; Aubrey isn’t taking a page rate at all! If we hit our first stretch goal, that changes, with Chris and Taylor getting raises and Aubrey getting a page rate.
$35,000: Stoned Master #2
The entire five-issue Stoned Master series is outlined and we yearn to make it happen. If we pull in enough cash on this campaign, we’ll be able to get a head start by funding the creative costs of issue #2!
$45,000: Everybody gets raises
Same as before, if we make $45,000, the entire team gets their increased rates on Stoned Master #2!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Aubrey's previous Kickstarter campaign – for the leftist superhero comic BEEF BROS – saw rewards delivered safely and on time to all backers. In addition, not only is Aubrey an experienced comic book writer, but he's also a former editor at Marvel (Punisher War Journal, Ghost Rider, etc.) and Image (The Walking Dead, Invincible), so he knows a thing or two about putting together great-looking books.

Chris is a seasoned, 20-year comic book and animation pro, well-versed in the world of self-publishing, having written, drawn, colored, lettered and published two printings of his comic Zombie Dickheads.

We have confirmed that our printer is operating at full capacity despite the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. We have also researched multiple shipping options in order to have back-up delivery plans in place. While additional challenges may arise, we will always be communicative and upfront with our backers about the status of our project.

International backers: The COVID-19 pandemic has caused significant delays in international shipping and customs clearance. While we're happy to ship Stoned Master #1 to you, please know that we cannot guarantee a time for its arrival.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
It's been a minute since I've babbled at you! I see these updates – being able to connect directly with Stoned Master backers – as a privilege that shouldn't be abused, which is why I'll keep them at one per month. If you want to hear from me more often, subscribe to my monthly newsletter, which provides updates on my Kickstarter books as well as all the projects I have hitting comic shops this year!
Enough of that! I know why you're really here: A GLIMPSE AT A BRAND-NEW PAGE OF STONED MASTER!

Stoned Master is happening. Chris Moreno and I are going to create the comic of our dreams, with big laughs, big action, and big ruminations on community-based politics. What's more, we're doing it the right way, delivering a premium product while keeping prices low and paying the folks involved fairly. But we couldn't have done any of it without you and your generous support. I continue to be blown away and so very grateful for this platform and opportunity to get my work in people's hands. Thank you for putting your money where your mouth is and backing gorgeous, gonzo, genre comics like Stoned Master.
WHAT'S NEXT?

updates.update_userinfo: FUNDED!!! Thank you, new art, what's next, and another rad Kickstarter to back!
updates.update_content:
With the support of hundreds of people just like you, doggone near 700 individual backers, Stoned Master has been funded! The pro-community kung fu comic is happening – there is absolutely no stopping us – but we've still got three days left in the campaign!
Just because the book's funded doesn't mean that I'm going to be shutting up about this thing. If you've seen the buzz, response, and demand to my previous Kickstartered book BEEF BROS, you know that come October, people are going to be on the hunt for extra copies of StonedMaster #1. So, please: Keep sharing our posts, keep telling people about the pro-community kung fu comic, and, if need be, add on a copy of Stoned Master for that friend you know will forget to back before Thursday.

updates.update_userinfo: ONE WEEK LEFT and we need your help!
updates.update_content:
Hey there! We've got one week left to go on the Stoned Master campaign and are currently about $3,200 shy of our goal. Below I show off some brand-new Chris Moreno art and tell you about another Kickstarter you must back, but first, some ways to help Stoned Master in its final week…
One of the things that really put us over the top on the BEEF BROS campaign were all of the kind, generous folks who ordered a double pack to share with a friend. If you know someone who would dig what we're doing on Stoned Master, considering upping your pledge to a Puff, Puff, Pass pack. Not only will it help us reach our goal and get the anti-gentrification kung fu comic made, but sharing is very much in keeping with the book's community-based politics!

updates.update_userinfo: LIMITED QUANTITIES of Stoned Master & BEEF BROS combo packs now available! Plus: A new interview and another super-rad Kickstarter to back!
updates.update_content: Heya, friends! As of this morning, we've cracked the $10,000 mark, which is 2/3 of the way to our goal. Awesome! However, with only ten days remaining, we need to cover some serious ground if we're going to successfully will the anti-gentrification stoner kung fu comedy into existence! That's why you can now get…

updates.update_userinfo: New art, meme fodder, why Stoned Master is so important to me, and another Kickstarter you should be backing!
updates.update_content:
We've passed the half-way point on the Stoned Master campaign, but we still need to raise a little more than $5,000 to make the anti-gentrification stoner kung fu comic a reality. Please keep talking the project up online, sharing our art drops, and, if you've got the dough to spare, consider upping your pledge to one of the Puff, Puff, Pass tiers so you have a copy to share with a pal! 
But we covered all that last time. I know what you're here for: New Chris Moreno art. It's time to meet some more residents of Chavez Heights!

updates.update_userinfo: Two weeks left; we NEED your help! Plus: Page #1 of Stoned Master, new character designs, recent coverage, and another Kickstarter you MUST back!
updates.update_content:
Alright, my fine-feathered friends, we are right here in the thick of our Stoned Master campaign with quite a ways to go. In order to get this thing across finish line, we're going to need your help. More on that in a minute though, because I can't wait a second longer…
CHECK OUT THE FIRST PAGE OF STONED MASTER #1!

updates.update_userinfo: Half-baked! We're 50% funded! Plus: NEW Stoned Master art, continuing coverage, another Kickstarter you MUST back, and favorite Cypress Hill songs!
updates.update_content:
Thank you for making Chris and my hazy dream come true, for giving us the freedom to create this unique melange of stoner comedy, Shaw Brothers kung fu movies, and community-based leftist politics. Stoned Master is a project that would have struggled to gain a foothold in the traditional comics market and we are so very fortunate to be able to connect directly with smart, interesting folks who appreciate and are excited about what we're building.
Early on in the Stoned Master development process, Chris did extensive, animation-style design work for  our cast. We've been sitting on these so we have new stuff to share throughout the campaign but what better way to celebrate hitting the half-way mark on our campaign than with some never-before-seen art!?

YOWZA! Stoned Master is more than 40% funded and rocketing toward its goal! By doing this book on Kickstarter, Chris and I are going to be able to make the stoner kung fu action comedy comic of all our hazy dreams, and it's thanks to you, the fine folks who will have been in on it from jump street!
That said, we've still got almost 60% of the way to go, so don't stop sharing Stoned Master on social media. And make sure tell all your friends, family, enemies and frenemies about it, whether they're cannabis enthusiasts, martial arts fans, or just people who love gorgeous and gonzo genre comics!

project_data.project_name: Stoned Master: The pro-community kung fu comic

campaign.story:
"Don't believe the world outside your window..."
Have you ever heard a piece of music that lodged itself so firmly in your mind that you couldn't get it out? Have you ever wished you could download all of your sad thoughts into a robot and then forget them? What if you only hope of survival depended on your ability to stay cloaked in invisibility from satellites of destruction above?
Critics are calling UNCANNY VALLEY "mind-blowing." Panel from EARWORM. (Art by Martyn Lorbiecki/Letters by Hassan Otsmane-Elhaou).
Welcome to the Uncanny Valley. A sci-fi comic book anthology series—in the tradition of THE TWILIGHT ZONE and BLACK MIRROR—from indie creators Martyn Lorbiecki and Rick Quinn, along with guest collaborators Nami Oshiro, Amie Wilensky, Hassan Otsmane-Elhaou, and more!
Shades of COMPUTER BLUE. Lisa is a BlueBot, an android designed to store sad memories from their human owners. (Art by Amie Wilensky).
Rick Quinn and Martyn Lorbiecki have been collaborating on comics for nearly five years together. Their first project was a short story called The Ghost Butterfly (which you can read for free here). Ever since, they've been developing the world of UNCANNY VALLEY—a place where they could explore their shared thematic concerns about reality and artificiality, music and memory, religion and robots—all told with their trademark melancholy storytelling style.
Martyn and Rick posing with one of their beautiful creations (this is also the illustration we're using as a signed/numbered bookplate in our "Paranoid Android" reward tier!)
ARCHIVE 001 is a trade paperback (est. ~80 pages) including comics, stories, essays, and pin-up art. The four main "feature" stories are:
EARWORM. Detective Minnie Sheppard investigates a string of bizarre homicides where headless bodies are found at the scene of the crime. The only pattern? They were all listening to music before they died…
CHAMELEONS. Humanity has almost been hunted to extinction by the geo-orbital defense system (G.O.D.S.). One family treks across a barren, snow-covered landscape—masked with cloaking devices—searching for a long-rumored sanctuary for those who have survived.
TELL US HOW YOU REALLY FEEL. Clyde's job is to deliver tough messages that may be emotionally difficult for the recipients to hear. That's why he delivers them using a cute robot.
COMPUTER BLUE. SunnySkies is an app that allows users to download all their negative emotions so they can live #happy and #positive lives! (Compatible with the latest BlueBot OS updates, of course).  But what happens when a BlueBot wants to have a life of their own?
Also included: 
Two critical essays about media and art that explores similar topics about the blurring of technology and reality. Edward Haynes writes about the memories of a fallen human society in the PLANET OF THE APES films and Tiffany Babb writes about Alex Garland's EX MACHINA and stories about male "creation" versus female autonomy.  Both essays will be accompanied by original illustrations by Martyn Lorbiecki.
A pin-up gallery composed of three of Martyn and Rick's favorite indie comic artists (Fell Hound, Don Austin, and Louis Grieves).
An original prose short story entitled Conscience Ltd. by Rick Quinn.
Detective Minnie Sheppard uses a Sonomic Eye to investigate the aural surroundings of a crime scene in EARWORM (Art by Martyn Lorbiecki/Letters by Hassan Otsmane-Elhaou).
A mother is forced to make an impossible choice in order to protect her family from the G.O.D.S.—the Geo-Orbital Defense Satellites—that hunt humanity to near-extinction in CHAMELEONS (Art by Martyn Lorbiecki/Letters by Hassan Otsmane-Elhaou).
"Just another day on the job!" From TELL US HOW YOU REALLY FEEL. (Art by Nami Oshiro).
"Wendy?" "Yes, Lisa?" From COMPUTER BLUE. (Art by Amie Wilensky).
Digital and physical editions of UNCANNY VALLEY—ARCHIVE 001. Physical copies will ship with a set of stickers!
UPDATE 5/26: *ALL* physical editions will now ship with a bonus ChibiBot enamel pin. This is an added incentive to get us past our goal, but also as a thank you to everyone who has already backed and supported us!
Postcard-style prints of our three special pin-ups!
Signed and numbered bookplate! This one gives our book a "human" touch.
SunnySkies coffee mug! Everyone at the office will know how well-adjusted you are.
"Identity portraits." Martyn will immortalize you as an honorary employee of the Uncanny Valley Narrative Research Institute. Your image will accompany your name in the special thanks section.
UNCANNY VALLEY watercolour paintings! The "u" is because Martyn is half-English.
Original art commissions from Martyn! Details are below.
UPDATE 5/26: Original music-related art commission from artist/musician/lovely human being Dave Chisholm!
The original cover art! Be the proud owner of Martyn's magnum opus: a sprawling, double-page illustration.
Front cover. Look at all those lovely names!
Promotional stickers approved by the Uncanny Valley Narrative Research Institute™.
ChibiBot is featured in our story "TELL US HOW YOU REALLY FEEL" and was designed by the artist Nami Oshiro.
Minnie from EARWORM, as drawn by our special guest pin-up artist Fell Hound. One of three prints available in our "+UPGRADE" reward tier!
Signed and numbered bookplate, featuring UNCANNY VALLEY's creators/editors Martyn and Rick.
SunnySkies coffee mug, featuring a panel from COMPUTER BLUE's initial concept sketches by artist Amie Wilensky.
An example of Martyn's "Identity Portraits". (Rick's cat Charlie not included.)
Original UNCANNY VALLEY watercolour paintings.
Commission Martyn for your own unique watercoloured illustration.
Music-related commissions from artist/musician/lovely human being Dave Chisholm!
Martyn's epic double-page, wraparound cover.
Rick Quinn is a writer based in Durham, NC. His previous comics include the Kickstarter-backed Spirit Drifters and The Negatives, as well as THE DEAD SPARROW and FIREPROOF. You can follow him on social media via @richquizzle or at his website.
Martyn Lorbiecki is a UK-based artist who's half-American, half-British and possibly a clone (or Replicant). His style is heavily inspired by science-fiction, technology, comics, anime/manga, video games, film, and music. You can follow him on social media via @m3rtyn or at his website.
Nami Oshiro is an illustrator and comics artist based in the DC-Metro area. She went to the Corcoran College of Art+Design in Washington DC, where she got a Bachelor of Fine Art in Fine Art in 2012. She's shown work throughout the DC-Metro area and has been featured in the comics anthology Sad and on the Internet. She also has a book coming out in 2022 called Flower Bunny. You can follow her on social media via @breezecast or at her website.
Amie Wilensky is an artist and illustrator from Dallas, TX living in New York City. A lifelong science fiction nerd, she is an avid reader of books, comics, shampoo bottles, and cereal boxes. She is interested in storytelling and aims to convey narrative in all of her work, from portraits to comics to editorial and conceptual illustration. You can follow her on social media via @AmieWilensky or at her website.
Hassan Otsmane-Elhaou is the editor of the Eisner-winning PANELXPANEL and creator of STRIP PANEL NAKED on YouTube. He has lettered graphic novels, ongoing series, one-shots, and web-comics for publishers like Image, Oni Press, and Vault. You can follow him on social media via @HassanOE.
ALSO:
Milton Lawson is a writer living in Houston, TX. His previous work includes THOMPSON HELLER: DETECTIVE INTERSTELLAR (w/ artist Dave Chisholm), which is being published in trade paperback format later this year from Source Point Press. His favorite movie of all-time is PADDINGTON 2. Twitter: @paddingtonmilton.
Tiffany Babb is a poet, essayist, and cultural critic. She's a regular contributor to The AV Club's Comic Panel and the Eisner Award winning PanelxPanel Magazine. You can find her poetry in Rust + Moth, Third Wednesday Magazine, and Cardiff Review. Twitter: @explodingarrow
Edward Haynes is a writer, critic, and editor based in Liverpool. They are the founding Contributing Editor of AN INSIDE OUT, a website that has explored how personal experience and context impacts readings of artworks of various forms since summer 2020. Twitter: @teddyhaynes
Fell Hound is an illustrator and writer from Toronto. She began her work in various fan zines and anthologies before launching her debut comic zine DO YOU BELIEVE IN AN AFTERLIFE? in 2019. Her subsequent comic, the sci-fi action epic COMMANDER RAO, was self-published to critical acclaim. Twitter: @FellHound_
Don Austin is a freelance artist/illustrator making his own creator-owned comics. His style is primarily geared towards creating sci-fi/cyberpunk/fantasy, all drawn in traditional media like pen and ink, pencil, and ball-point pen for sketches. Twitter: @DtronAustin
Louis Grieves is a graphic designer & illustrator in the beautiful city of Lyon, France and is a self-described "geek, pop-culture nerd". Twitter: @LouisGrievesArt
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my third Kickstarter campaign. My first two campaigns met their goals and everything shipped out on schedule. The fact that I've seen multiple creative projects through from conception to completion hopefully speaks to my ability to deliver a quality finished product.

The only foreseeable risks are possible shipping and printing delays, but we've set a realistic schedule in which we can produce and ship our book.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: UNCANNY UPDATE 013: end of the campaign, special thanks, and what's in store for the future of UNCANNY VALLEY?
updates.update_content:
Hi!
Final Totals: 117% funded. $9,485. 221 backers.
Back in UPDATE 010 where we had one week left and I said we needed at least 50 more backers to hit our funding goal, I'd be lying if I said my confidence wasn't slightly shook—but thanks to y'all and to the generous support of so many people who amplified and hyped our project, we made it and more! Martyn and I have a few surprises up our sleeves concerning how to invest our extra 17% back into UNCANNY VALLEY—ARCHIVE 001. We will keep you updated as we begin the process of compiling the finished book, as well as beginning the fulfillment process in general.

updates.update_userinfo: UNCANNY UPDATE 012: 48 hours left! Less than 10 backers away from 200!
updates.update_content:
Hi there,
48 hours left!
We're nearly finished! If you have any changes to make to your pledge, this is your last chance. So if you want to upgrade to a higher reward tier, or add-on some of my previous books, the clock is ticking!

updates.update_userinfo: UNCANNY UPDATE 011: 100% funded, 5 days left & new appearance on the Wednesday Lounge podcast!
updates.update_content:
Greetings,
100% funded, 5 days left!
We have reached our funding goal! I'll wait to do a full-length appreciation post when we reach the end of the campaign, but for now: thank you all so much for backing UNCANNY VALLEY. Martyn and I have worked really hard on developing this campaign for the last few months (and these stories for the last few years); and we're humbled by your continued support and encouragement. We couldn't have done it without you.

updates.update_userinfo: UNCANNY UPDATE 010: one week left, ChibiBot enamel pins, and new super-limited Dave Chisholm commission tier!
updates.update_content:
Hi all,
One. Week. Left!
We have seven days left for our campaign. We're currently at 75% funded, with 159 backers. We have $2,059 more to raise. Our average pledge is $38. I'm generally pretty terrible at math, but that essentially means that between now and next Wednesday we need ~50 more backers in order to be successful. Our project currently has over 200 "followers" who have not backed us yet. Kickstarter will email them a reminder in the last 48 hours of the campaign. We want to be funded before then though! So what's the plan? Well...

updates.update_userinfo: UNCANNY UPDATE 009: Comics for the Apocalypse podcast & plus my comic book origin story!
updates.update_content:
Good morning,
Comics for the Apocalypse podcast!

updates.update_userinfo: UNCANNY UPDATE 008: new international shipping options & new add-on rewards!
updates.update_content:
Hi there,
New international shipping options
Kickstarter doesn't make figuring out international shipping super easy. You have two options: offering shipping to "anywhere" at a general average OR adding each country and setting prices individually. Neither is ideal. Setting one flat rate for *all* international shipping is going to make some people pay more than they need to, some less; it's a mess. Researching and setting prices for each individual country available would take forever and probably wouldn't be time well spent on my part.

updates.update_userinfo: UNCANNY UPDATE 007: a deeper look at the financials of a Kickstarter project
updates.update_content:
Hi,
As we get close to our last week of the campaign—with still a healthy amount to go (currently we're at 63% funded)—I thought it might be interesting to give a more in-depth look into the inner workings of a Kickstarter specifically as it relates to our goal and the money we're here to raise. Why is the goal what it is? Where does the money go?

updates.update_userinfo: UNCANNY UPDATE 006: Taylor Swift, colouring book, and ChibiBot!
updates.update_content:
Hi!
Thanks to everyone who participated in our virtual project meeting last Saturday! Unsurprisingly, the hour-long conversation was mostly centered around Taylor Swift. And weird bugs. It was very appropriate for the UNCANNY VALLEY.

Hi,
Just a quick reminder: Martyn and I have opened our weekly project meeting to the public. Come by and say hi! We have no plan or structure, hopefully just an opportunity to get to hang out and talk with some friends both old and new.
Link will be: http://meet.google.com/mhu-gbci-ies

campaign.story:
THE DEADLIEST BOUQUET is a new 120 page full-color original graphic novel written by Ringo Award nominated writer Erica Schultz (Daredevil), interior artist Carola Borelli (Destiny, NY), colorist Gab Contreras (TRVE KVLT), and editor James Emmett (I Am Hexed) with a fabulous cover by Kevin Wada (Scarlet Witch).
In 1998, three estranged sisters trained by their Nazi-hunting mother come together to solve their mom's murder…and try not to kill each other in the process. Rose, Poppy, and Violet Hawthorn had an unusual upbringing. Their mother, Jasmine, was the daughter of Nazi hunters and indoctrinated into La Résistance after WW2. After moving to the United States, Jasmine settled down and had three daughters, but her hard-lived past caught up with her.
The Deadliest Bouquet explores the relationships these sisters have with each other and their complicated bond with their mother. Can Rose, Poppy, and Violet put their resentment aside to find Jasmine's killer? This is a family of secrets…and they're all about to be laid bare.
Art by Carola Borelli and Gab Contreras
Art by Carola Borelli
Violet feels her mother, Jasmine, was holding her back by teaching them all these amazing skills and then not letting them use them, which is why she freelances as a hit-woman while modeling overseas. She never backs down from a fight and is known to instigate one when she’s bored. Violet is a Taurus.
Art by Carola Borelli
Poppy hated growing up in a house so filled with secrets. Poppy’s husband, Derek, is oblivious to her family’s history and Poppy’s training. He just thinks she’s a stay at home mom and part-time bookkeeper. Poppy is a Cancer.
Art by Carola Borelli
Rose feels obligated to help Jasmine run the flower shop since she's the oldest and most responsible. She resents her sisters for leaving and having lives of their own. Rose is a Capricorn.
Art by Carola Borelli
Jasmine was trained in the art of espionage and assassination by her parents who were part of La Résistance in WW2. She lived all over the world hunting down escaped Nazis with her family but left after her brother's death on a particular mission. She resisted raising her girls the same way, but is pushed to the edge. Her death is what brings Rose, Poppy, and Violet together. Jasmine is a Pisces.
Art by Carola Borelli and Gab Contreras
Art by Carola Borelli and Gab Contreras
Art by Carola Borelli and Gab Contreras
Art by Carola Borelli and Gab Contreras
Art by Kevin Wada

Not actual book
5 x 7 print by Alane Grace
Customize your reward tier by adding on extras items! (Shipping costs may increase.)
If we hit our goal of $20,00, we've got several stretch goals planned!
“The Deadliest Bouquet is the real deal; vivid characters, snappy dialogue, crisply expressive art, and intriguing mysteries. Looking forward to learning more about the sisters’ messed-up childhood…” – Andy Diggle (The Losers, Green Arrow)

“I love a vendetta story & this is 100% up my alley.” – Skylar Partridge (Resonant)

“Take a little crime, a little mystery, a little action, and a quest for revenge, mix in some engaging characters and razor-sharp art, you wind up with a winning comic like The Deadliest Bouquet.” – Erik Burnham (Transformers: Beast Wars, Godzilla)

“An incredible tale of intrigue, murder and beautiful bouquets. With such an amazing team bringing their best, this needs to be on your shelf.” – Tríona Farrell (Crowded)

“The Deadliest Bouquet packs quite the punch. Schultz’s script is perfectly complimented by Borelli’s art and Contreras’ colors. A killer concept, dynamic characters, and a plethora of plot twists that had me page-turning with excited anticipation. A must-read.” – Jeremy Holt (Made in Korea, Virtually Yours)

“Dark secrets, deadly skills, and delightful art, absolutely my cup of tea. Seriously! Put the next issue in my hand!” – Yoshi Yoshitani (I Am Not Starfire)
Erica Schultz is comic book writer and editor known for her work at Marvel (Daredevil), DC (Hawkgirl), Image (Where We Live), Red 5 (Legacy of Mandrake) and others. She was part of DC Comics' first Talent Development Workshop, and is the creator of the five-time Ringo nominated series Forgotten Home with comiXology Originals.
Carola Borelli was born and raised in southern Italy and moved to Rome to attend the University of Architecture and the International School of Comics. In 2019 she collaborated with Space Between Entertainment for Destiny: NY Vol. 3. She often works with A Wave Blue World and other indie publishers.
Gab Contreras is a comic book colorist, graphic designer, and illustrator from Lima, Peru. She has worked on several books for various publishers, most notably Dead Beats (A Wave Blue World), 2000 AD Summer Special 2018 (2000 AD), 20 Fists (Source Point Press), and others. Gab is currently working on Witchblood (Vault Comics), TRVE KVLT, and a couple of TBA projects.
James Emmett is a freelance comic book editor based out of Brooklyn, NY. He is the editor and creative director on the series I Am Hexed. His clients have included Marvel Entertainment, 451 Media, Mezco Toyz, Wayward Raven and more!
Kevin Wada has been a working cover artist for the last 10 years. His process of marrying watercolors and digital gives his work a distinct and modern feel.  He's contributed to books like She-Hulk, Iceman, Catwoman, Runaways, the Simon Snow series, and more!
Alane Grace is a Filipino-American Illustrator & Design artist living in Pasadena, CA. In recent years, she has credited work as a background painter for Crunchyroll's Onyx Equinox and Hulu's Solar Opposites. She loves to draw a certain winter spirit and a fairy queen.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every Kickstarter has risks, but we're very confident in our ability to fulfill everything in a timely manner and keep you, our incredible backers, well informed if any unforeseen issues arise with outside vendors. James Emmett has run several successful campaigns for 451 and I Am Hexed, and he's the brains behind this operation, so I put my faith in his talent and experience. Thank you again for choosing to back The Deadliest Bouquet!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: THE PRESSURE!!!! GAAAAHHHH!!!!

We've got three days left!
Can you believe it? Rose can't.

It's the final countdown!
We would use the music, but we don't want to get sued. That aside, there's only FIVE DAYS LEFT on the Kickstarter for The Deadliest Bouquet!
Can you believe it?!

Thank you for getting us to $22,000…and passed it! 
And with 11 days left, that means we can kick The Deadliest Bouquet up to 11 as we're going from a 70lb paper stock to an 80lb paper stock. Those in the know know how nice this is. (Yes, we're paper nerds.)
Now that we've unlocked the first stretch goal just in time for the weekend, so it's on to the next one! The print by ! If we get to $24,000, all those who backed the campaign at the physical book tier gets Adriana's print FOR FREE!

campaign.story:
WE ARE FULLY FUNDED! 
Thanks for supporting Smoke Weed, See the Future. Scroll to the bottom of the campaign page for new stretch goals!

What if a vision of the future was just a puff, puff, pass away?
Main cover by LUISA RUSSO

Meet Taylor Hart. She was born a seer, which means that she can look at a person and see their future. All of her life, it's been both a gift and a curse. She wishes she could control it... but now, she's found a way to use her gift to help others.
While attempting to grow a strain of marijuana that could help her control her visions, she ended up creating a strain that helps regular people see what she sees.
The future.

SMOKE WEED, SEE THE FUTURE - interior artwork by Yishan Li

Now, Taylor starts a business helping people...

SMOKE WEED, SEE THE FUTURE is a 70+ page graphic novel written by me, PAT SHAND, writer/creator of Destiny NY & Snap Flash Hustle, illustrated by superstar artist YISHAN LI (Buffy, Hellboy, Swing, Sugar), with a bonus comic by comics legend JENN ST-ONGE, who also contributed an incredible variant cover.
Here's some of Yishan's gorgeous interior art for the book:

SMOKE WEED, SEE THE FUTURE - interior artwork by Yishan Li
SMOKE WEED, SEE THE FUTURE - interior artwork by Yishan Li
 A HILARIOUS, MOVING GRAPHIC NOVEL ABOUT FOUND FAMILY, TRYING TO DO THE RIGHT THING, AND LIVING THE GOOD LIFE THROUGH A HAZE OF SMOKE.
Taylor, Pimento the Cat, & Gretchen style & design by Jenn St-Onge
In addition to our main cover by the incredible Luisa Russo, we have a spicy, super limited variant cover by superstar artist Jenn St-Onge.


JENN ST-ONGE VARIANT -- ONLY THROUGH KICKSTARTER!
And here's a peek at Jenn's interior work for the bonus chapter!
Smoke Weed, See the Future interiors by Jenn St-Onge
Taylor, the lead of SMOKE WEED, SEE THE FUTURE was introduced in my series DESTINY, NY... an ongoing graphic novel saga about what happens to a prophecy girl AFTER she completes her foretold destiny.

If you want to catch up on Taylor's past, you can also get all four volumes of DESTINY, NY through this Kickstarter! They are available in print and digital.
Taylor in Destiny, NY
Taylor in Destiny, NY
Taylor in Destiny, NY

SMOKE WEED, SEE THE FUTURE can be read as a standalone story, but it'll also connect to DESTINY, NY for readers of that series. 
We also have other spinoffs of DESTINY, NY featuring other characters.


PLAY

We always pay extra during production for extremely high-quality books with thick, velvety paper quality. Here's a glimpse at how the Destiny, NY books came out.

As a team, I have worked with Jim Campbell since the start of my career. He has lettered every single one of my creator-owned books, every Space Between Entertainment (that's our company!) title, and probably more than half of my work-for-hire comics. Shannon Lee edits every Space Between book as well, and has helped shape Destiny, NY into not just a single comic but a nuanced universe. We're so happy to welcome Yishan Li to the team for our first collaboration and are excited to see Jenn St-Onge, who has illustrated some of the very best covers for our titles in the past, contribute interiors as well.
Keep reading to check out our amazing rewards, including:
the graphic novel itself
the chance to get drawn into the book
SMOKE WEED, READ COMICS button
behind-the-scenes PDF
signed bookplate
and more!
[Reprinted from the original Destiny, NY Volume Three print by original artist Manuel Preitano, this will be printed on trippy, holographic material.] 

In addition to the main tiers, you can manually adjust your pledge to add these awesome items.
Now, add-ons have been added officially through Kickstarter, so you can do this ON YOUR PLEDGE with a new menu!
Here is everything we have available.
First, is the main series I fund through Kickstarter, my long-running Destiny, NY graphic novels. This series follows Logan McBride, a girl who was the subject of a prophecy as a child. She completed this prophecy when she was just 13, and now she's entering her 30s trying to find meaning in her life post-Destiny. That's when she meets Lilith, the last surviving daughter of a mystical crime family... and from this point on, their lives will never be the same.
You can see more about each volume through the original campaigns;
 Destiny, NY Volume 1 ($20 print, $10 digital)
 Destiny, NY Volume 2 ($25, $15 digital)
 Destiny, NY Volume 3 ($25, $15 digital)
 Destiny, NY Volume 4 ($25, $15 digital)
 Destiny, NY Short Stories Collection 1 
 Gangster Ass Barista- A Destiny, NY Spinoff ($20 print, $10 digital)
 Cherry Gilbert: Necromancer- A Destiny, NY Spinoff ($20 print, $10 digital)
And the newest addition to the SPACE BETWEEN catalog is...
$20 per add-on
In addition to Destiny, NY I have funded two other series along with a few standalone graphic novels on Kickstarter. In doing this, I have formed the company Space Between Entertainment to produce these comics, a podcast, video content, and more. Here's our current slate of available graphic novels that you can add to your order:
 Prison Witch: A mystical thriller about the magic that happens behind bars at a women's prison. Two volumes so far, with more to come. Volume 1 has a cover by Jenn St-Onge, and Volume 2 has a cover by Natasha Alterici. Written by Amy Shand & Pat Shand, illustrated by Erica D'Urso. ($20 each)
 Afterglow: A post-apocalyptic epic about a girl and her giant, radioactive cat. Written by Pat Shand, illustrated in full color by K. Lynn Smith. ($20)
 Spooky Girls: A full-color, graphic novel made up of 4 new monster comics, each written by Pat Shand and illustrated by different artists: Jenny the Werecat, Vicky Slime, Punk Teen Demon Queen, & Tarantula Twins. ($20)
 Modern Dread: A horror anthology about modern anxieties. Created by Ryan Fassett & Pat Shand, including contributions from ARMY OF DARKNESS artist Larry Watts, THE WALKING DEAD (TV Series) writer LaToya Morgan, & more. ($15)
 Clonsters: A young Earth Nugget attempts to find her lost Splat in this all-ages adventure about monsters made out of clay. Written by Amy Shand & Pat Shand, with illustration by Vanessa Cardinali. Two Volumes so far! ($30 for the full series)
 Vampire Emmy & the Garbage Girl: In this horror/rom-com, a vampire falls in lover with her sanitation worker who has a secret of her own. ($20)
 Thirsty: 4 erotic comics entwine in this NSFW graphic novel. ($20)

And you can also add on any of the items from the campaign added as individual items!
 $17,500 - UNLOCKED!: Editor Shannon Lee and I will record an audio commentary for Smoke Weed, See the Future giving behind-the-scenes stories about production as well as a deep dive into the character arcs and meaning of the story.
 $19,000 - UNLOCKED!: Spot Gloss! The standard cover will receive a spot gloss treatment over the matte finish to make for a beautiful final product.
 $20,000 - UNLOCKED!: In addition to the main story and Jenn''s bonus chapter, I will write a prose Smoke Weed, See the Future story to expand on Taylor's journey.
 $25,000 - UNLOCKED!: The prose story will be expanded to include new pages, lengthening the graphic novel with new artwork by Skylar Patridge! 
ALL STRETCH GOALS UNLOCKED! THANKS FOR AN AWESOME CAMPAIGN!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Between this and the projects I've funded over at our collaborative Space Between company page, this is my 18th Kickstarter campaign. In a creative endeavor of this size, possible challenges could be delays in production or printing depending on the current situation with the quarantine, considering we ship overseas. However, we have successfully Kickstarted multiple projects before as creators AND as a team, which has given us the utmost confidence that we'll meet and exceed your expectations, no matter what is happening in the world. When hiccups are hit, we send updates. When we receive our shipment, we get them our to backers immediately without delay. I mean, why would we want to hold onto the books when we're so eager for YOU to read them?

One thing that we can't control is customs charges and the price of international shipping. We pay more for international shipping than we charge, but some countries will charge an extra customs fee based on the prices of the items included. Our advice there would just be to be aware of that.

Our backers deserve the absolute best, and we promise to deliver the highest quality, the best communication, and all questions answered quickly -- ALWAYS!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE #6: PDFs for add-ons, Taylor's Backstory, & SBE Digital Library Sent!
updates.update_content:
Hey Smoke Weed, See the Future backers!
Welcome to our monthly updates! Here, I will send information every single month to you about where we are with production, information from the printer, confirmation of rewards, previews of art, all that good stuff. For our first update, I'm happy to let you know that...

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE #5: Thanks for an awesome campaign!
updates.update_content:
Hey Smoke Weed, See the Future backers!

Thanks so much for an awesome campaign! This one hit a few milestones for the Space Between Entertainment team, which makes me so happy and proud. This was our second most funded campaign ever, right after our previous one, Thirsty. Also, it is not only the most funded Destiny, NY spinoff BUT ALSO the most funded Destiny, NY book ever, even including the main series. That makes me so thrilled to do what we came to do... and that is make you an awesome book to read.

Hey Smoke Weed, See the Future backers!

You did it! Our entire first slate of Stretch Goals has been unlocked, thanks to your generous pledges. That means that we are now adding a bonus prose story to the graphic novel, which will expand the story of Taylor and her farm, where one can smoke this very special chronic. Now, this also leaves us in the position of already having reached our goals...

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE #3: First two Stretch Goals unlockerd!
updates.update_content: Hey Destiny, NY backers!

Hey everyone!
Stretch Goals have been added, and we're already VERY close to unlocking the first. Thanks for making this an intense ride of a campaign, and remember -- this is just the first block. If we unlock all of these, we have many more ideas for how to keep enriching the Smoke Weed, See the Future experience.

campaign.story:
Alright, students, welcome back for another fun-filled year of learning and living here at Eklund High School. Whether you spent your summer working a part-time job or visiting family in the Realm of Infinite Screaming, we expect you're rested and ready to face everything that your junior year has to offer. And we certainly hope you finished all the grimoires and spell books on your summer reading list.
You only skimmed them? Oo, too bad, because we're starting out with a pop quiz. First question: If you summon a demonic familiar, how far away from you can that frustrating little imp actually go? Not as far as you thought? If you'd done the reading, you might've realized how difficult that limited range would be to work with on school grounds, where the strict ban on demonic familiars may leave you suspended before first period's even over.
Second question: What are three short-sighted teens and their terrible imp to do?
Issue 2 Cover
Created by Jordan Alsaqa and Ray Nadine, the second issue of Raise Hell! brings school back in session with even more haunted hijinks and coming-of-age comedy. Because even in a world of demonic curses, witch covens, and literal human soul food, high school remains a proving ground of messy emotions, dorky teachers, and trying to just make it out alive.
Issue Two follows Victor, Miri, and Reeves dealing with all that and more as they struggle to find a way to hide their troublemaking demon Alistair from staff and student alike. With Ali unable to venture more than 100 feet from any of the teens, the day becomes a gauntlet of near-misses and desperate searches to find a permanent solution to their problem.
Oh, and Victor can't wait to finally join the paranormally inclined Spectral Science Club! He... may not be as focused on the task at hand as he should be. It's going to be a long first day...
With this campaign, our goal is to raise funding to complete and print physical copies of Raise Hell!: Issue 2. As a thank you for supporting the project, we have a number of reward levels, including digital and physical copies of Raise Hell!: Issue 2, a brand-new mixtape pin, script edits from Jordan, and physical commissions from Ray. At the top level, you can even appear in the book as a student or staff member of Eklund High School! And for new readers, we've got numerous catch-up reward packages and add-ons that'll let you grab everything you may have missed out on in the first campaign.
Included below is a special preview of the issue!
And if you're new to the party, you can get a look an even more art with a preview of the first issue below!
Click through for that first issue goodness!
PRAISE FOR RAISE HELL!
--"Raise Hell! is a fresh, whimsical take on teenage life combined with what we've always wanted - blood sacrifices, demon spawns, and a wicked fun time. Clever occult humor and colourful, expressive artwork makes this a must-read." -Fell Hound (Commander Rao)
--“As a former varsity athlete, I was disgusted by this group of high school slackers. But as a reader, I was endlessly delighted by their easy camaraderie. High school can be one of the toughest times in your life, but this book is sure to remind you of the great friends who got you through it. Nerd.” - Mark Stack (Young Offenders!)
--"Raise Hell! returns for issue #2 featuring another ingeniously funny script from Jordan Alsaqa and more vivacious neon-soaked art from Ray Nadine. The attention to detail the team puts into Victor, Miri, & Ali pays dividends big time by giving us one of the most charming and engaging cast of friends in comics. Back Raise Hell! with extreme confidence!" -Frankee White (20 Fists, Starless Daydream)
BACK-UP STORY
In addition to the main story, issue two of Raise Hell! is foregoing the stretch goal entirely and adding in a guaranteed eight-page back-up! The story will be written by Jordan and drawn by our first guest artist, Kelsi Jo Silva!
Whereas the first issue's "Demon King of Ska" put Victor's musical passion in the spotlight, it's Miri who'll take the stage for this issue's "Clothes Make the 'Mon". Dissatisfied with every piece of clothing she makes for Ali, Miri realizes to make the best demonic clothing, she's going to need some demonic materials. The pair sets out for a special market that exists between realities, where one off-handed comment is all it takes to set off a rivalry between tailors of the insectoid and arachnoid persuasions.
The back-up story's rival tailors, designed by guest artist Kelsi Jo Silva
Take a look below at the first page of inks from the story, and see more at her website!
Ali experiencing all the lows of mid-00s fashion.
Writer Jordan Alsaqa (he/him) is an N.C. State graduate with a degree in Creative Writing. He’s successfully funded numerous comics through Kickstarter, including Terminal Protocol, Finding Peace, and We Have to Go Back, as well as the first issue of Raise Hell!. His rural horror comic, Welderkin, co-created with Joni Miller, was published digitally by Comicker Press. His work can also be found in numerous anthologies, including Alloy Anthology: Electrum from Ascend Comics and You Died from Iron Circus Comics. Jordan’s junior year of high school was spent doodling stick figures, helping run a Creative Writing Club, and failing to appreciate all the bottomless wells of energy that youth has to offer. You can keep up with Jordan's other projects on Twitter and at his website.
Artist Ray Nadine (they/them) has been drawing since they could hold a pencil, and has been making comics since 2013. They're currently working on a graphic novel for Dark Horse that they're contractually obliged not to say much more about, and also illustrated Messenger on Webtoon. They've had stories featured in a handful of anthologies, notably Everything Is Going Wrong (edited by Mark!) and Local Haunts, edited by Kara Lais.  Ray's also created the webcomic Dollhouse, and several short comics including Anchored, The Collector, The Ties That Bind, and Something Had Changed. When Ray isn't working, they're playing too much Final Fantasy XIV, watching anime, or rough-housing with their cat. Their favorite band is My Chemical Romance and they still listen to all the same crap they listened to in high school. Keep up with their art and projects on Twitter and their website.
Editor Mark Bouchard (they/them) is a non-binary writer/editor in Chicago, by way of New England who has been self-publishing comics since 2016. They are the editor and creator of EVERYTHING IS GOING WRONG: Comics On Punk & Mental Illness, and their writing has been published in a number of comic anthologies including A Wave Blue World’s Dead Beats. They are currently writing a horror graphic novella due out in early 2021. Outside of comics, Mark enjoys curry and black coffee, often at the same time. They also write satire for The Hard Times and Hard Drive. You can follow them on Twitter for updates on their work and their dog, Juicebox. To read their short comics, and learn more about their past work, visit their website.
Guest Artist Kelsi Jo Silva (she/her) is an artist and illustrator based out of Denver, Co. She has been muddling her way through the process of getting a creative career off the ground since graduating from the Rocky Mountain College of Art and Design in 2014. Kelsi has worked on a number of odd projects and jobs but is most notably the illustrator for the Ela Cat series of children’s book published by Good Luck Black Cat Books—the first of which won both a MoonBeam award and a CIPPA EVVY award for illustration. In the last three years, Kelsi has shifted her focus from Children’s books to comics, which are her true passion. She's self-published a few short stories and had the opportunity to pitch a multitude of projects with an array of talented writers. Kelsi revels in the fact that she gets to spend her days drawing and her evenings re-watching Star Trek. It's truly a dream. To see more of her work, check out her Twitter and website.
For funding, approximately $1500 will go towards paying the remaining page rates for Ray and Kelsi Jo for  drawing, coloring, and lettering their respective stories. Roughly $1000 will go towards printing the book itself, with an additional $300 going towards producing the new campaign rewards, and potentially reprinting some of the old ones. Finally, another $1000 will go towards shipping and fulfillment costs, while the final approximate 10% will go towards Kickstarter fees. Any additional funds will go towards reimbursing Jordan's initial investment before any possible stretch goals. These rates are based directly on our final totals from the previous campaign, so we are confident they should accurately reflect what we'll need for fulfillment.
Below, you can get the full rundown of all the various reward levels available for the campaign. As always, we've done our best to make sure that every backer, however big or small, is getting plenty of bang for their buck, in addition to our eternal (infernal?) gratitude. Domestic US shipping is included in each total. STANDARD REWARDS are listed first, with the relevant CATCH-UP PACKS listed at the end.
And for the first 48 hours, the Physical Issue, Enamel Pin, and Physical Catch-Up levels are available for a special early bird price!
At the Digital Issue level, you'll receive a PDF copy of Raise Hell!: Issue 2. The digital copy will include all the same material as the physical book, including any stretch goal additions to the book.
With the Digital Catch-Up level, you'll get both the first and second issues of Raise Hell!, allowing you to get fully caught up on the story so far. You'll also receive additional PDFs of stories either written by Jordan or written/illustrated by Ray: Finding Peace by Jordan Alsaqa & Marie Enger, We Have to Go Back by Jordan Alsaqa & Sally Cantirino,  A Wolf in Sheep's Clothing by Jordan Alsaqa & Kacee Navarro, Zom-BMX! by Jordan Alsaqa & Ben Humeniuk, Dollhouse by Ray Nadine, Anchored by Ray Nadine, and The Ties That Bind by Ray Nadine.
At the Physical Issue level, you’ll receive the print edition of Raise Hell!: Issue 2, signed by artist Ray Nadine!
At the Enamel Pin level, you’ll get a special 1.5" hard enamel pin of Renlo's Lofi Beats to Study To Mixtape. The perfect mixtape playlist for mellowing out and cramming equations and historical facts into your head that you'll forget as soon as the test is over. (NOTE: All previous mixtape pins, including the between-campaigns Retrowave pin, are available as add-ons!)
Of course, if you're looking to go all-in on the pins, the Pinsanity level is for you! At this level, you'll receive all five mixtape pins (Ska, Pretentious, Anime, Retrowave, Study Vibes) at a discounted overall price. This is the only reward level that contains all five pins; higher levels will require additional pins to be added on.
At the Editorial Review level, Jordan will work with you to help edit and refine either a comic script (max. 30 pages) or pitch document that you’re working on. This includes two rounds of edits and the option for an hour-long web or phone call. Jordan has a decade of previous editing experience, including numerous comic script and pitch edits, as well as work-for-hire rewrites.
Want a Ray Nadine original to add to your collection? At the Art Commission level, you can do exactly that, commissioning an original 5"x7" traditional art piece from Ray. The artwork will be pen, ink, and spot color Posca. When you back at this level, you’ll be contacted to make sure Ray is comfortable with the subject you’d like to have drawn. You can see an example of this level right below!
Finally, have you ever wished to go back to high school? Of course not, but I'm sure your animated avatar would love the chance! At the Classmate Cameo level, you can appear in the book as either a student or faculty member at Eklund High School! You'll also receive a social media icon drawn by Ray Nadine, as seen below!
With the Physical Catch-Up level, you will receive physical and digital copies of both the first and second issue of Raise Hell!, giving you the complete mainline story so far.
Looking for every morsel of Raise Hell! story content you can find? With the Fiery Catch-Up level, your catch-up pack will now include a copy of Welderkin: The Complete Series, which features "Raise Hellderkin!", an exclusive bonus crossover that collides the two horror-comedy worlds co-created by Jordan Alsaqa. The eight-page short is illustrated by Ray, and hey, you'll also receive the complete 98-page Welderkin story, too!
If you're new to the book and that all still isn't enough, the Ultimate Catch-Up level combines every physical and digital reward from both Raise Hell! campaigns. That includes both books, the digital PDF collection, all five enamel pins, a copy of Welderkin: The Complete Series, and the exclusive riso print from the first campaign, as seem below.
Finally, for any retailers, we of course have the Retailer level, which provides 10 copies of the book at wholesale price for sale in your store!
ADD-ONS
As the second Raise Hell! campaign, we've got a number of rewards and products left from the previous campaign that we want to make sure new fans and old can get a second chance at! The stock for all of these items are, of course, limited, but any of the following can be added to your order. Whether you're an old fan looking to grab something you missed or a newcomer looking for a bit more flexibility than the above catch-up packs provide, we hope you'll find what you're looking for below!
Raise Hell!: Issue 1
Easy enough, a physical copy of the first issue of Raise Hell!
The Mixtape Pins
Whether you're looking to add the new Study Vibes pin to your catch-up pack or hoping to grab one of the previous designs, all five pins are available as add-ons.
Ska Mixtape Pin
Pretentious Mixtape Pin
Aniime Mixtape Pin


Finding Peace
A copy of Finding Peace by Jordan Alsaqa and Marie Enger.
Welderkin: The Complete Series TPB
Deep in the woods, an awful din,
The clanging of the Welderkin...
With this add-on, you can get the complete Welderkin trade. Co-created by Jordan Alsaqa and artist Joni Miller, Welderkin is a rural horror/comedy tale focusing on welder demons, hidden secrets, and backwoods hijinks. In addition to the 98-page main story, this book contains a special Raise Hell! crossover story not available anywhere else.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The main risk is the possibility of pricing changes for services such as printing and shipping that could affect estimates. However, the current campaign estimates are built with a significant buffer to account for this possibility, and our goal is to begin printing rewards as soon as the funding hits our account. These estimates have also been updated based on final totals from the previous Raise Hell! campaign. Jordan and Ray have collectively run and fulfilled six successful Kickstarter campaigns, including the previous Raise Hell! campaign, and are dedicated to doing so once again here.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
