updates.update_content:
Hey ThoughtScapers, 
I'll keep this REAL brief since I just did an update the other day, but I wanted to share a peek at the hard copy proof sheets I received this very morning. I am quite in love with the uncoated 70lb paper stock for the interior pages. 
Enjoy!

Hello ThoughtScape Backers!
A quick note to let you know the hardcopy proofs for the comic are in transit, on their way to me so I can review and approve the issue for press. Pretty exciting and I am anxious to see how things look on paper (that didn't come out of my functional but ancient inkjet, of course). 

Did I ever show you all those homemade proofs?

Hello ThoughtScape Comics backers!
A quick note to let you know that this week I approved the electronic proof of ThoughtScape Comics #1 from the printer, and now it's on to some hard copy proofing. This stage of the process has taken a bit longer than I anticipated (mostly due to last minute tweaks by yours truly and copious amounts of repeated proof-readings), but it's in the interest of making a hopefully slightly unique book (old-school, uncoated paper stock!), and something that will serve as a template for the future issues, so I think it'll be worth it. Here's a peek at what a spread looks like in the e-proof stage, if that's something in your wheelhouse...

updates.update_userinfo: Ex Post Facto artist Karl Slominski launches EVERMORE FALLS Kickstarter!
updates.update_content:
Hey ThoughtScape backers! Happy Friday!
Just a quick note to let you know that Karl Slominski, artist of ThoughtScape Comics' Ex Post Facto, just launched a great new Kickstarter you should check out...
EVERMORE FALLS!

updates.update_userinfo: TSC #1 files to the printer TODAY! Plus EVERMORE FALLS from Karl Slominski!
updates.update_content:
Happy Monday, ThoughtScape backers!
I'll keep this REAL brief, as I am deep in the doing of last minute tasks related to getting the files for ThoughtScape Comics #1 ready to send to the printer TODAY, but I wanted to let you know about Karl Slominski's upcoming Kickstarter for EVERMORE FALLS!
Karl is, of course, the amazing artist of ThoughtScape Comics' Ex Post Facto: A Dask Varrick Misadventure, and EVERMORE FALLS is the first of a bunch of solo projects Karl is releasing this year. Go give it a follow so you can be among the first backers of this excellent original ALL-AGES fantasy graphic novel about saving the world from MONSTERS! You don't want to miss this. I mean, look at that teaser image!

Hello ThoughtScape Comics gang!
First, the big news, KS funds made their way into my bank account this morning. For the crowdfunding process nerds or creators among you considering or running a Kickstarter, here's how the $ breaks down for TSC #1 (fellow KS campaigners, watch out for dropped pledges, I caught on too late to effectively follow up with a few folks to have them try and update their payment methods) ...

Hey all!
Just a quick note to let you know what's up with ThoughtScape Comics #1!
I think I'll be receiving funds from KS next week. In the meantime I am doing the pre-press work, prepping files for the comic for print. A lot of time in Adobe InDesign.  Shouldn't be too much longer before I have this thing all set for the presses.

Wow, was it really only Monday that the campaign ended? I guess this was a long week...
I'll keep this brief, or try to, because I have files to prep for print.
Status report:
We're in the middle now of the two-week window during which Kickstarter collects pledge payments. Funds will make their way to me in another nine days or so it sounds like.
Update coming this weekend, in the meantime I thought I’d share some sick inks from Luke Horsman for our story Out of the Mouths of Babes, slated for ThoughtScape Comics #4! Enjoy!

We did it!
Thanks to all of you, ThoughtScape Comics #1 was successfully funded, and then some. AND OVER 400 BACKERS! This being my first Kickstarter, I really had no idea what to expect... and my mind is blown. I really appreciate all of your support.
The final numbers...

campaign.story:
We Are Scarlet Twilight #1 is the first issue (24 pages) of a 4 part comic series inspired by 1930's and 40's pulp adventure comics and art deco imagery.  As a comic fan, there are so many cool design elements and visuals in golden age stories that always capture my attention- but sometimes the stories aren't quite up to 2021 expectations. I wanted to find a way to dust off all the good stuff there and bring it into a modern story... and hopefully throw in a few twists that will surprise!
Cover to We Are Scarlet Twilight #1

Enter the story's hero-- Captain Lancet. He's a 1930's All-American crime buster* who accidentally creates the world's greatest villain before waking up a century in the future. He'll need to adjust to a strange new world-- Fritz Lang's Metropolis with some cyberpunk dystopia sprinkled in-- if he wants to overthrow the totalitarian vampire cult that now dominates the future.

*some of these things are not, strictly speaking, the truth

The Team for We Are Scarlet Twilight … is well, just me- a jack of all trades commercial artist who loves putting together comics.  My previous comic,  August: Purgatory Underground is completed and coming out soon from Action Lab’s Danger Zone imprint. While it’s great having a publisher and team to work with, it seemed like the time was right to get into crowdfunding- the freedom of being able to control my book and schedule, through pandemics and other chaos, was a huge draw.  And there are so many great looking books from indie creators coming up now in the Kickstarter comics community... I wanted to be a part of it!

This campaign is my first, so I’m trying to keep it my goals modest- enough to cover producing the 24 page comic, an alternate cover and a few fun extras that are a cool way to support production! Being as it’s my first time out, I want to keep things simple as I find my crowdfunding sea legs, so I’m printing these on demand at KaBlam, who'll ship them to you in a Gemini mailer. If this is a success- and I hope with your help it will be- for the next campaigns I’ll have a better idea of what to expect, and can get these printed up in bulk and get the physical issue cost down! That all said, I'm a newish creator, We Are Scarlet Twilight is a new book, and you have a lot of other cool options for your entertainment dollar! I want my book to get out there as much as it can, so I'm keeping my digital prices at $2.
Variant Retro Cover for We Are Scarlet Twilight #1
While I want to keep a few of the plot points under wraps... I'm sure you want to see what the interior pages look like! Pages 1-5, and a few out of sequence extras that give an idea of the atmosphere but don't give away the story can be found below!
We Are Scarlet Twilight #1 Page 1
We Are Scarlet Twilight #1 Page 2
We Are Scarlet Twilight #1 Page 3
We Are Scarlet Twilight #1 Page 4
We Are Scarlet Twilight #1 Page 5
We Are Scarlet Twilight #1 Page 14 (Unlettered)
We Are Scarlet Twilight #1 Page 16 (Unlettered)
We Are Scarlet Twilight #1 Page 24 (Unlettered)

If you're a fan of Buck Rogers and Flash Gordon serials, Fleischer Bros Superman cartoons, Golden Age Comics or old school horror and crime stories, We Are Scarlet Twilight is made for you!  I hope you'll check it out!

One more thing... I guess it wouldn't be a good kickstarter without some kind of fun reward option. Did some research. I've seen some things you people wouldn't believe: apparel, pins... something called a waifu pillow I cannot unsee. 

But that's not cool. You know what's cool? 

Aprons. 

Check out the addons to get YOUR very own Captain Lancet apron.
Holy ##@%! Your very own Captain Lancet Apron!!!!

Risks and challenges
As with just about anything the last year or so, stuff can come up. I'm estimating it'll take about a month to finish the art on #1, and then the weeks it'll take the printers and USPS to do their thing!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: YOUR Scarlet Twilight News for Thursday, June the 10th, 2021
updates.update_content:
Quick update- will be talking to the printer tomorrow to see if we can start things up without it becoming two separate orders (still missing about 80 responses), if that will work I'll get that process rolling! In the same vein, I'm going to finalize the "thanks" list tomorrow, so I'll be using the name on the pledge unless specified differently in the response. 

A couple of you had managed to pledge for the US version but are overseas- I've had the issue open with KS support for a while now but not getting much of a response. I'll keep on that.

updates.update_userinfo: YOUR Scarlet Twilight News for Thursday, June the 3rd, 2021
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone! All the surveys are out, and the files are ready to go to the printers when we have all of those responses! 

In the meantime, to give me something to do draw we're waiting- a stretch goal! The first of these was some origins comic strips that fill in the backstories of some of We Are Scarlet Twilight's supporting characters. I'll be sending these out as updates, and the first installment is below in this very update! Hope you enjoy it!

updates.update_userinfo: YOUR Memorial Day Scarlet Twilight News!
updates.update_content: Dashing off a quick update...

updates.update_userinfo: YOUR Scarlet Twilight news for Saturday, May 15th!
updates.update_content:
Hey, All American-Lancet Legion!

Wanted to share a quick update, and a preview of some art! 

Getting the issue ready to send out to the printer (who's also handling fufillment), which should happen aroudn the 24nd-29th. I'll be sending out the fufillment survey early next week to get all the info for them together!

First off-- I want to thank everyone for all their support over the last month!
So now... Kickstarter will be doing their pledge thing over the next 2-3 weeks, and I'll be ... can it be true?... DRAWIING again as I wrap up the issue!!! Huzzah!
I'll be posting updates with in progress, non spoiler art and story clues- hopefully it'll be fun to follow along!

Very excited to share today's update. It's a longer one, but it's riddled with fun info about our hero and the threats he'll face in every paragraph!

Lately, a few folks have asked about retailer tiers, and I finally have that figured out and costs confirmed! Adding that pledge option tonight!

updates.update_userinfo: YOUR Scarlet Twilight News for Friday, April the 16th, 2021
updates.update_content:
International Version now available! After a lot of back and forth, and I'm sure grumbling on the part of the fine folks answering my many questions, I've got shipping worldwide. Was really hoping to find a cheaper solution to this, but I appreciate everyone's patience with me on this!! When we set up issue 2, I'll have a lot better idea what to expect here!

And as always, a few cool comics I'm excited to link to!

campaign.story:
Down below the abandoned skyscrapers and crumbling colonial architecture, beneath the buzzing lights and ragged billboards, is a fading, floundering city propped up by vice, extortion, and fear. This is BLACKSTONE—a dark, mirror image of Boston or Philadelphia. A city whose history dates back to the earliest days of our nation.
Blackstone. A city in need of a hero!

 A once-mighty industrial titan—now teetering on the edge of oblivion. A city that used to mean something.

Blackstone public defender Jaime Nuñez -  former baseball hero, now a divorced dad to a precocious teen - is always trying to do his best.  But the criminal justice system is not without limits. When Jaime comes into an unexpected fortune and some surprising, super heroic tools, he discovers there might be another, more direct way to do some actual good in the world.

When a new hero appears, a flicker of hope cuts through the darkness.
But can the masked man known only as The Dusk push back against decades of entrenched corruption without compromising his commitment to social justice...

Much less his teenage daughter's?

spoiler alert: probably not!

Creation.Ink is proud to present our latest oversized 8x12 hardcover graphic novel, THE DUSK,  brought to you by the minds and talents of Alex Segura, Elizabeth Little and David Hahn, with Ellie Wright and Taylor Esposito.

(Read more about the creation of The Dusk HERE!, thanks to our friends at BOING BOING.) 

Has anyone ever seen The Dusk and Jaime Nuñez in the same room?

THE DUSK is a modern reimagining of the superhero vigilante that flips the script on the traditional “might makes right” approach while adding the grounded, socially conscious perspective that modern crime fiction has become known for. 

The graphic novel blends the dark deco of BATMAN: THE ANIMATED SERIES with a dose of moral complexity and dark humor, creating an engaging and witty look at the inner workings of a beloved genre through the eyes of a flawed, human, and heroic figure.

Aided by an all-star team of fan favorite creators: Howard Chaykin, Francesco Francavilla, Jamal Igle, Rebekah Isaacs, Gabriel Hardman and more, Jamie  Nuñez has begun to fight the never-ending battle for the heart and soul of Blackstone City. 


Pete Woods' stunning hardcover variant cover



But The Dusk will need your help to finish the war!


the legendary Howard Chaykin's variant Dusk cover
                              The Creative Team
The creative team behind the project draws on a wealth of professional experience and diverse personal backgrounds to create and enrich the characters and world of The Dusk. Together, they bring decades of storytelling experience in various formats to the project. 
 Alex Segura is an acclaimed, award-winning writer of novels, comic books, short stories, and podcasts. He is the author of Star Wars Poe Dameron: Free Fall, the Pete Fernandez Mystery series (including the Anthony Award-nominated crime novels Dangerous Ends, Blackout. and Miami Midnight), and the upcoming Secret Identity. His short story “Red Zone” won the 2020 Anthony Award for Best Short Story, and his border noir short story, “90 Miles” will be included in THE BEST AMERICAN MYSTERY AND SUSPENSE STORIES of 2020. He has also written a number of comic books, most notably the superhero noir The Black Ghost, the YA music series The Archies, and the “Archie Meets” collection of crossovers, featuring real-life cameos from the Ramones, B-52s, and more. He is also the co-creator/co-writer of the Lethal Lit crime/YA podcast from iHeart Radio, which was named one of the best podcasts of 2018 by The New York Times. By day he is Co-President of Archie Comics. A Miami native, Alex lives in New York with his wife and children.

Elizabeth Little ( elizabeth-little.com )  is the best-selling author of Dear Daughter, Pretty as a Picture, and two works of nonfiction. Her crime fiction has been nominated for the Barry,  Macavity, and CWA John Creasey Debut dagger awards, and she received the Strand Critics Award for Best First Novel. Her latest novel, Pretty as a Picture, was Barnes and Noble monthly pick and a Los Angeles Times and Publishers Weekly bestseller. Her writing has also appeared in the New York Times, McSweeney’s, and the Los Angeles Review of Books, among other publications. 

David Hahn ( davidhahnart.com) has professionally illustrated comic books for over 20 years, including issues of Spider-Man Loves Mary Jane,  Marvel Adventures: The Fantastic Four for Marvel Comics, and Batman ‘66/Wonderwoman ‘77, Fables, and Fringe for DC Comics, as well as The Batman Handbook, licensed for Quirk Books.

             David was nominated for both an Eisner Award and an Ignatz Award for his creator-owned comic series, Private Beach, published by Slave Labor Graphics.

Joseph Illidge ( josephillidge.com ) is the Executive Editor for Heavy Metal magazine. Previously, he served as an Editor on the Batman line of comics for DC Entertainment, Executive Editor for Valiant Entertainment, and Senior Editor for “Hair Love” producers Lion Forge on their superhero imprint, “Catalyst Prime.” Joseph’s first job in the comic book industry was at Milestone Media, Inc., the groundbreaking publisher of inclusive superhero stories and creators of the animated series “Static Shock”, and he was featured in the History Channel documentary “Superheroes Decoded."

Ellie Wright is a Comic Book Colorist from The Republic of Ireland. Ellie's background is in Art, she has studied Creative Media Design at Crawford College of Art and Design. Ellie has been a freelance Comic Book Colorist since 2016,  and has worked for global publishing companies including: Dynamite Entertainment, DC, Image, and POW Entertainment. Ellie is also the proud winner of ICN 2018 & 2019 ‘Best Published Colourist in Ireland’. Some of Ellie's titles include Elvira: Mistress of the Dark, Betty Page: Halloween Special / The Secret Diary / Unbound, Sherlock Holmes: The Vanishing Man, Batman: The Shadow, James Bond: Goldfinger and many more. Ellie's work can be found here: www.elliewrightartist.com

Taylor Esposito ( ghostglyphstudios.com ) is a comic book lettering professional, owner of Ghost Glyph Studios and teacher at the legendary Kubert School. A former staff letterer at DC and production artist at Marvel, he has lettered titles such as Red Hood and The Outlaws and Constantine; Interceptor, Heavy, Finger Guns (Vault Comics), Exorsisters, Jook Joint (Image), Babyteeth, Hot Lunch Special, Knock ‘em Dead (Aftershock), and No One Left to Fight (Dark Horse). Other publishers he has worked with include Line Webtoon (Caster, Backchannel) Dynamite (Elvira, Red Sonja and Vampirella meet Betty and Veronica, Green Hornet), and IDW (Scarlett’s Strike Force). 
                                  REWARDS
Creation.Ink and the creative team behind The Dusk have banded together with an amazing array of guest talent to create a selection of unique, collectible rewards to help our project hit its funding goal. Take a look!

SHIPPING WILL BE CHARGED THROUGH OUR PLEDGE MANAGER AFTER THE KICKSTARTER CAMPAIGN HAS SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED. We will charge backers a shipping fee based on the cost for our fulfillment partners to ship from their hubs to you. We will ship your rewards to the hubs of our fulfillment partners. From there, our partners will ship out packages to you as soon as they are received.  PLEASE NOTE: shipping costs have increased due to circumstances beyond our control. The addition of extra copies and items will require additional shipping.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The experienced creative and production teams behind The Dusk and Creation.Ink have worked in the comic book and collectibles industries for more than 75 years collectively. The funds raised through this campaign will fund the production and printing of the graphic novel and rewards. We have scheduled a realistic production timetable of the book that will allow the creators to produce top notch work while also delivering the final product to our backers in a very reasonable amount of time.

Alex Segura, Sean HusVar, and everyone on the team understand the trust that it takes for you to back our work. We will do everything we can to complete and ship the project on time. However, several of our recent projects have run into unanticipated delays, specifically related to the Covid-19 pandemic, and we need to acknowledge that the pandemic continues to provide a degree of unpredictability in the day-to-day production of projects. In case of delay, we will always strive to be transparent and keep our backers updated throughout production.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Citizens of Blackstone!

Have you missed us? We've missed you too! 

We hope all of you are doing well out there since The Dusk campaign ended. As our project progresses through the production pipeline (try saying that five times fast!), you can expect updates about once a month, maybe more frequently as nears completion and we reach the fulfillment stage.

Citizens of Blackstone!

WE DID IT!! The campaign is in the books and we couldn't be more pleased. Thanks to all of you, The Dusk has become a reality. Thank you isn't a big enough word (two words, actually) to express our gratitude. So instead of trying, here's another pin up that will be colored and featured in the Hardcover edition.

updates.update_userinfo: A few words from The Dusk team...
updates.update_content:
Citizens of Blackstone!

Normally, we try to get these updates out to you earlier in the day but it's been a bit like herding cats to get the videos below from The Dusk team. They've been partying nonstop since The Dusk campaign hit its funding goal yesterday. No one has even seen Joe Illidge since he rented a speedboat for what he promised was just going to be a quick jaunt to the Mohegan Sun in Connecticut. If anyone sees Joe out on the Thames River, tell him we're a little worried, OK?

Citizens of Blackstone, we are FUNDED! 

Thank you very much for making this project possible! You'll be hearing more from the creative team behind The Dusk tomorrow but we wanted to spread the word and make sure everyone knows that we are officially a go!

Citizens of Blackstone! 

We've had a tremendous run over the last 24 hours and as these words are being typed, The Dusk finds itself perilously close to hitting its funding goal this morning. Not to put the cart too far ahead of the horse but thank you all so much for everything you guys have done to help us bring this project to life. In particular, we want to present the first-ever key to Blackstone City to the mysterious ELMI, who has supported this project in a way that has blown us all away. We're going to cook up something special just for you, Elmi, and while we're sorry it won't be that Apainting you were hoping for, we hope you'll understand our gratitude for your tremendous gesture.

Citizens of Blackstone! 

Are you guys ready for what should be a wild week? The Dusk is currently 92% funded with 71 hours left in the campaign. We're excited for these final few days and the exhilarating sprint to the finish line that's ahead, and glad you guys are our "ride or die" until the very end.

Citizens of Blackstone!

Some very cool new Dusk pin up art arrived at the Ominous offices today so, before we get into our regularly-scheduled update, don't mind if we flex a little! First up, a lovely piece of awesome by Vincente Federici!

updates.update_userinfo: And then there were six... days left!
updates.update_content:
Citizens Of Blackstone!

The clock continues to tick and with six days left before the curtain falls, The Dusk campaign currently sits at 86% funded! Thanks (and welcome) to all of our new backers and thanks also to those of you that upgraded or added on to your pledges to get us to this point.  None of this happens without you guys and we appreciate your support.

Citizens of Blackstone!

One full week left in The Dusk!  It feels like just yesterday that we nervously pushed the button to kick off this whole campaign and now we're down to seven days. Man, time flies when you're having fun, right?

campaign.story:
Cycle Dogs Seattle: Our Journey
Cycle Dogs started as a one-man operation, with a hot dog cart pulled behind a tricked-out custom bicycle. Most of you know us as the mighty vegan food truck that could, with a small crew. After almost 4 years as a food truck, it's time for us to take the next leap and become a restaurant, or Cycle Dogs can’t live on.
Cycle Dogs Hot Dog Cart
The Story
Picture this: Keaton (CD Owner) working a corporate desk job at an architectural firm, many steps removed from seeing anyone tangibly enjoying his work. He then decided to parlay his love of cooking, commitment to a vegan lifestyle, and knack for bicycles, to start a food business. Cycle Dogs was born, as Seattle’s first all-vegan hot dog stop. (A vegan diet has nearly half the carbon footprint of a traditional omnivore diet, and for many it’s also about compassion and personal health.)
Cycle Dogs Food Truck
Keaton was on his way, living the dream of sharing his experience of delicious vegan food with fellow vegans, and with vegetarians and vegan-curious alike. Two years after starting the cart, he made the big move onto the food truck, with regular staff, and a larger menu. Through lots of hard work and dedication in the three and a half years since, Cycle Dogs has gone through growing pains, triumphs and setbacks, learning and improving along the way. We’ve tried some crazy things from veganizing entire chain copycat menus to German Oktoberfest fare - working fairs and corporate events, and our amazing recent run of trying out some chick'n sandwiches.
Cycle Dogs Food
When you make something in the food services world, you get to see the impact of your work. At Cycle Dogs, we love bringing happiness to people through food. We’ve been blessed with an amazing expanding family of customers, who have motivated us to keep getting better (and more creative!) at what we do. We always feel excited and privileged when Cycle Dogs is a customer’s first touchstone of vegan choices.
With our successes of the last few months, it has become clear that we've outgrown the truck. We have busted our rumps, but have sometimes really struggled to keep up with demand at peak times.
Cycle Dogs Food
Why should I help? 
The next chapter for Cycle Dogs to grow would be to serve out of a restaurant, with a larger kitchen, to offer broader menu and service options to a wider audience, and to be able to introduce veganism and vegan food to even more people! The Cycle Dogs community is vast, filled with amazing customers who are extremely supportive of our food, our journey, and who share our passion for vegan fare. As a person who loves food and/or vegan food, we would LOVE your help and support as we try to bring and widen our passion in the greater Seattle area. 

What will I get out of helping Cycle Dogs?
You will get our many many thanks for supporting our small business and helping to bring our dreams to life!!! In terms of Kickstarter rewards, you have the options for the following depending on the reward level you choose: (Please see Rewards options; it's a top menu item on a mobile device, or it's on the right on the desktop version)
Our thanks and appreciation, expressed via email and social media!
Custom Founder Tile on the wall of the restaurant
Cycle Dogs face mask
A dozen bottles of any of our house-made sauces
Cycle Dogs T-shirt or apron
Photo(s) you take, installed on a tiled photo wall for our 1-year anniversary
Meal and Masks for Two
Private Dinner for Two
Commemorative Investor Tile on the wall of the restaurant
Private Party for up to 35 at the restaurant

What will my contribution bring Cycle Dogs?
We’ve signed a lease, but need your help to equip the kitchen:
Gas range + install
Fryers + install
Prep fridge
Worktop fridge
Prep tables
Shelving for the walk-in
Kitchen shelving
Grease trap cleaning
Ice machine
Commercial mixer
8 tap draft fridge
Reach-in freezer
Heat lamp w/ shelf
3 compartment sink and faucet + install
1 prep sink + install
1 hand wash sink + install
Fire extinguishers 
Fire suppresion system adjustments
Cycle Dogs will cover:
Furniture
Permits
Patio
Decor + Renovation
  OK, I’m with you so far. But I have to know, where will you be located?!
New restaurant space in Ballard
This part is truly exciting for us, for several reasons. We’ll be moving into a little place in Ballard, right off NW Market Street, on 17th Avenue NW. You might know it as the former home of the No Bones Beach Club! There's something extra special about moving into this space.
As many of you know, the Cycle Dogs food truck was once the No Bones truck, where they got their start!! It feels right to maintain the vegan legacy of that restaurant space.
When will you open?
Our target date for opening in the new space will be April 12th!  We will of course send updates to all backers and post important updates on this page.

Why, and why now?
Keaton and the team - and our families - are deeply thankful for how far Cycle Dogs has been able to come, with the support of our amazing customers.
The food business is hard work! Food truck life brings with it a whole list of additional hurdles to jump on a weekly or daily basis. Emptying and filling the water tank, getting propane, frequent shopping runs, tight work spaces, weather extremes, dead batteries, you name it.  The things that could have gone sideways, did and it was always when we least expected it. 
The core crew stuck it out through the adjustments needed to keep us going during the pandemic. Some of them have been along for the adventure for tours of one, even two years.  They’re thrilled at the idea of being able to show up to work in a predictably dry and warm building with reliable plumbing and electricity, with more space for food prep/service and to work. We hope it will be a better experience for everyone.
Cycle Dogs Food
Let’s unleash the full potential of Cycle Dogs in Seattle!
We understand we’re still in a pandemic, and that times are still weird and uncertain. There’s no “best time” to make this move, but this is where we're at. This is what we need. And we're turning to you guys for help getting us there because we’ve already availed ourselves as much as we can sustain with loans and reliance on bank capital.

What next?
A big part of Cycle Dogs is capturing that nostalgic feeling of having a good fast food or comfort meal, and offering it in a vegan context. We know we will continue in that spirit, anchored in what you know as “Cycle Dogs.” A restaurant space will enable us to get even more creative with what we can offer you, and to try new things for you to enjoy with us.
We’ll provide regular updates!

What will you do with the extra money if you exceed your goal?
We will go for a stretch goal! There is a lot of renovation work we need to do in the dining area and outdoor patio. A stretch goal could help us reduce our loan amount to finish the space!

What happens if you fail to meet your goal?
If we don’t make our fundraising goal, Cycle Dogs will not live on. The bottom line is that being a food truck isn't sustainable for us and down the line we will probably have to close.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Given that we are in a pandemic, we understand that challenges lie ahead. What if this pandemic drags on into 2022? Can Cycle Dogs survive without indoor dining for an extended period of time? We sincerely believe that we can with your help. Our current sales projections including this Kickstarter will be enough to cover our rent and other added costs anticipated with a brick and mortar model.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
WE DID IT!

We wanted to give a huge shout out and THANK YOU to all of our customers and friends who backed our project. Together, we were able to raise over $50,000 to help us bring you more elaborate vegan street fare in a new restaurant space.

Our last day at the Dane will be April 4th. As we transition out of the truck and into the new space, we will be closed April 5th - 13th. We will be take out and delivery only as we continue to renovate the new space. We will keep you updated on any outdoor or indoor dining options as they become available.

project_data.project_name: Cycle Dogs Seattle: From Food Truck to Restaurant!

campaign.story:
Well, the thing I made is a comic book.  It is 8-pages long, but that's just the comics part.  There's also a cover and a back cover and some other words my Dad told me to write on the inside so everyone knows I'm the one who made it.  
5.5" x 8.5", 8-page, black and white, comic book +cover
In the story, there's this guy with a horn, his name is Honk, and he has some friends named Pig and G.  "G" stands for goat, but he doesn't exactly look like a goat.  And there's also a bully when they go to this school.  He's not very nice, but the story kind of shows what to do in a situation like that.

I'm a 7-year-old boy and I'm good at Math and I like to draw.  It's nice to draw.  And also I'm a tall kid in my class.  My name is Owen.  

Why I'm sending this out is because it's not a good thing to be bullied.  You should stand up to that bully if they are bullying you or someone else.  If you see a bully bullying someone else, then you are a bystander and you should report the bullying, the same as if someone was bullying you.


Honk and Freands - "Jungle Gym", full-color, limited-edition, 5.5" x 8.5", print.
Author with Original Artwork (8.5" x 11", marker and crayon)

Me and my dad are printing Honk comic books so we can send them out to people.  My dad has some experience making and giving comics to people.  He's a comic artist, he makes watches, and he even has some comics classes that he teaches.

My parents asked me how much money I would be happy with.  $20 sounds like a lot to me, so that's what my dad put as our goal.

After we make the books, then we will send them out to people who would like the Honk comic.  My dad has this weigher thing just for mail, so we can weigh it and then we will know how much it costs to mail it.  Then we can just mail it to people who want it.  

This is the way we think our plan will happen:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Hm...well, some risks and challenges that I might include are that the comic we send off to you in the mail might come a little bit late, because our mail service is a little behind these days because a lot of people don't want to go to the store. So, the mail people have a lot on their shoulders. Like me, I had to wait for a remote control stunt car that took 3 more days than what they told me. So when we mail the books it might take a little while. But to help that, me and my dad are saying, "Maybe it'll take one or two weeks longer," just so we have enough time. He says this is a contingency. 

Something else I wanted to say is that the entire comic book is already drawn, so you won't have to wait for me to finish that.

Another risk could be, you know, what if our printer doesn't have any printing-out stuff. But to make sure that doesn't happen, we have an extra load of that stuff that helps the printer print stuff out. 

My dad is also helping me a lot by printing the comic and typing what I say here. My mom said she would help, too, but I don't know with what part. Maybe stapling the comics and packing them up. So, it's not just me working on this. It's kind of like a family effort.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello Fine Folks,
Owen's Dad here with a final report to all backers.

Final Expense Report
We wanted to be completely transparent about what was happening with the unexpected windfall of cash that you each bestowed upon us.  The short of it goes like this:

Hi Everyone,
Guess what showed up right before the weekend.  The special prints!  So, I put numbers and my name on all 125 of them.

Hi,

 Limited-Edition Print Delay
We did not get the special prints yet.  They say they're on their way.  It feels like it's taking a long time, but I'm sure they'll get here pretty soon.  Mr. Rogers has a song that talks about how it's very, very, very hard to wait.

Hi,

Fulfillment Continues
After the mail person picked up those 20 books yesterday, we packed a whole lot more.

Hi, everyone!

Fulfillment Starts
Today was our first day of packing up books.  When I woke up this morning, I came downstairs and saw my daddy doing this...
Guess what showed up yesterday!

Hi Everyone,

The last time I talked to you was last week.  This week there haven't been a lot of exciting things happening, but we do want to tell you how things are going and answer a question we got.

Hi again,
Guess what came today!

Book Proof
Dave the print man and my first Honk book!

Hi everybody,

My dad told me about a couple of things today so I'm going to tell you about these things, too.

Printing Delay

Hello Owen Supporters,

This is Ryan "Owen's Dad" Claytor.  I have a lot to say this update, but let's start with a morning message from the man of the hour...

project_data.project_name: Honk: A comics story about bullying by a 7-year-old creator

campaign.story:
THE STORY
There have been four previous suns over four previous earths...each one born of the gods' sacrifice and each destroyed by the gods' conflicts.
When the gods came together to create the Fifth Sun, the Soul Guide of the Dead, Xolotl, refused to perform his own sacrificial rite. Jaded after millenia of destruction and death, Xolotl hid away and watched his family sacrifice themselves in the name of hope for life beyond themselves.
Xolotl, alone and ashamed, became racked with guilt, causing him to weep so intensely that his eyes fell from his head and descended to the center of the newly forged universe: the Aztec capital of Tenochtitlan.
Seeing an opportunity to redeem himself, to honor the sacrifice of his family, Xolotl guided the Aztecs to forge two macahuitl, imbued with a piece of his own godhood. The Left and Right Eye of Xolotl, entrusted to twin siblings to wield together in defense of the Fifth Sun, became known as...The Twin Blades.
Art by Julio Suarez and Rocco Langg, logo by Andrea Rosales
Now in the year 2108, the blades are entrusted to twins Xiomara and Basilio Gutierrez who inherited them as children. Xiomara is strong willed, determined, and believes in herself. She's committed to her role as wielder and her sworn purpose of defending the Fifth Sun...but Basilio? Well, there isn't exactly a bunch of threats to the Sun running around and he's ready to move on with his life. Leaving his role as Wielder behind to pursue his goal of becoming a teacher, Basilio strains his relationship with his sister. 

Unfortunately, things are rarely so simple. The Lord of the North himself TEZCATLIPOCA sees a distracted pantheon and a set of divided Wielders as an opportunity to mobilize his pawn YAOTL: a resurrected traitorous Jaguar Warrior now obsessed with never returning to Mictlān, the land of the dead. Yaotl is bestowed with a blade forged from the primordial Black itself and sets out to destroy the Fifth Sun and create a new universe for Lord Tezcatlipoca.

Can Xiomara and Basilio stop arguing long enough to stop Tezcatlipoca's champion? Even if they can...will it be enough?

THE TEAM
The Twin Blades is a latine story and is proudly produced by an entirely latine team of creators:
Written by Jarred Luján: Jarred is a Mexican-American comic writer from the promised land of Texas. A 2019 Mad Cave Studios winner, he broke onto the comics scene with the four-issue mini-series Dry Foot. He likes the Wu-Tang Clan and existentialism. 

Art by Julio Suarez: Julio Suarez is a Mexican illustrator, having worked his whole life towards becoming a comic book artist, his passion for drawing has allowed him to work for companies such as Upperdeck Ent. and Cryptozoic Ent. as a sketch card artist, working with licenses such as Marvel and DC Comics, as well as freelance illustration work the last couple of years, now making his debut in the comic industry with “The Twin Blades” as an artist, he is ready to show the world what he can do!

Colors by Rocco Langg: Based in Mexico City, she has worked on several comics ranging from commercial work for Mexican companies to her interactive IG comic Goodbye and Fuck You! She has a passion for sci fi and vibrant colors.

Letters by Gabriela Downie: From California, Gabriela has been in the comic industry for 7 years. She's done a little bit of everything including production art, cover art, and lettering. Her work includes Harleen, Beast Boy Loves Raven, Punchline, and Batman '89.

THE SWORDS
The LEFT EYE of XOLOTL, wielded by main character XIOMARA
The RIGHT EYE of XOLOTL - Wielded by main character Basilio
The blades of THE TWIN BLADES
THE PREVIEW PAGES 
THE PRONUNCIATIONS
While you wait for THE TWIN BLADES to hit your eyeballs, learn to pronounce some of the more intimidating words for English speakers:
Xolotl
Tezcatlipoca
Macuahuitl
Xiomara
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks are minimal. Though this is my (Jarred) first Kickstarter and Julio and Rocco's first long form comic work, we are more than halfway completed with inks and working through colored pages as we speak. Though delays are possible with this sort of a new undertaking, the likelihood remains low.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey, folks!
I know it's been one whole week since we spoke, just dropping in to let everyone know that letters have been completed for the book. Gabby crushed it, knocked it out of the park. She's elevated the book so much and I am so excited to share the work that this incredible art team, from Julio to Rocco to Gabby, have accomplished. If nothing else, the book is gorgeous to look at.
With that said, Rocco has just 4 pages left of colors, so she'll be done by next week. So, expect surveys then! After colors are completed, Gabby will perform her magic on putting the lettered designs on the colored pages, then we'll immediately (and I mean ) post a PDF for you all to read. I'd expect to read it within two weeks.

Hey, folks.
Just a quick progress update. As previously noted, all the inked pages are completed. Rocco has just entered the home stretch for colors, I believe we are on track to have those finished next week, if not shortly after. Gabriela is lettering the rest of the pages.
All in all, I expect to be fulfilling the digital copy this month with physicals delaying until July. Like I said, the book will likely be done by the end of this month, July will just be waiting for it to get back from the printer. Fun stuff!

Hey, folks!
Just dropping in to let all of you know that last night Julio completed inks for THE TWIN BLADES. We are moving forward this week with getting the pages letter and the last dozen or so pages colored. Really exciting to see all the pages done in their inked glory. Alejandra, as I say every update, is killing it with colors. We're so close to getting this book in your hands!

Hey, folks!
Long time no see. I know I promised to not blow anyone's email up until we had some real news to share, but there was some concern about the lack of updates, so I wanted to hop in and give you a real quick peek behind the curtain.
We hit a production snag, but Julio has currently caught up and has only four pages left to pencil/ink. Pretty straightforward stuff, at his current pace I expect pages to be done within the next few days.

Hey, folks!
Just one last check in of the campaign. On the production side of things, Gabriela has just turned in 30 pages worth of letters, we're almost halfway through with colors, and I think we're down to just 9 pages worth of inks. If all goes well, the next three updates will be the completion of the book, the book heading to print, and the survey announcement. 
Thank you all again for your support on this. This campaign has hit almost every single goal I wanted it to. It's been stressful, it's been intense, but it's mostly been fun as hell. I'm psyched for y'all to get your hands on this book.

Hey, folks!
We are in the FINAL WEEK of our Kickstarter. That...is very cool. I'm proud of a lot from this Kickstarter, but we'll go into details about that stuff after this week concludes. So, the most you need to glean from this is that we still have about $3k until we get all those extra stories, so if you have anyone you know would dig this, the time is NOW to tell them to back it. They are running out of time, folks!

Hey, folks. 
Just a check-in as we close in on our final two weeks. We currently stand at 246 backers! We're still a ways away from our big stretch goal at $7500, but I'm still feeling pretty good all thing's considered. If we hit 250 backers by NCBD. I'm sure at least one of us have four friends who haven't backed (...right?) so let's get them in here if we can.
With that said, just a few small things. For those of you who have asked about restocking the tiers, it is not looking super great, so if you are wanting to get ahold of the trade without much of a wait, my advice would be to get it from your local comic shop or order it from . If you were wanting it signed, you may have to wait until my second Kickstarter later this year, which brings me to...

Hey, all!
I'm a little late from my last update, and I apologize for that, I wanted to kind of turn down the noise on our campaign for a moment so that a few projects I'm really into were able to get more of spotlight on them.
With that said, we're back in it. We have officially made it through our first week, we've got three left to go, so now we turn our sights to STRETCH GOALS. There is only one, but it's a doozy. The short explanation is that, because of you, I am able to give Mexicans swords, but why should I be the only one having fun doing that? So, introducing...

campaign.story:
They Call Her...The Dancer is a story that focuses on the beauty and brutality of dance and martial arts, delving into the morally gray psyche of a professional dancer and assassin.

At first glance, They Call Her…The Dancer is about analyzing the similarities and differences between dance and martial arts. Dance is something that is seen as beautiful, but many don’t think about the pain that is done to one’s body to truly be a dancer. Martial arts are thought of as violent because it’s a form of “fighting”, but there’s also a dance like quality to this work of art.
But once you dig deeper, the reader will quickly realize that The Dancer is actually a story about mental health. Mia is forced to face her own childhood trauma of witnessing her parents’ murder when she becomes the enemy that she once dedicated her life to fight against. The Dancer is a morally gray story that shows that good and evil aren’t so black and white.
With They Call Her...The Dancer #1, you get...
A 22-page, stapled, standard sized comic book printed by Comic Impressions,
including a Black & White edition
and FOR THE FIRST TIME also in COLOR! 
 5 Covers to choose from, including a limited Kickstarter Exclusive FOIL cover!
 Here's what comic book critics and pros are saying about THE DANCER:
Kat at comic conventions way back when those were a thing...
They Call Her...The Dancer #1 COVER A
Cover B - Perfect Blue Homage - Saw Nai Mon
When brainstorming variants for The Dancer, I knew I wanted something to showcase the shattering of 2 identities. Mia can’t be a fully formed person because she still has one foot in the past. The anime film Perfect Blue goes through similar themes of identity, and its movie poster was a perfect homage for our premiere issue.
Saw Nai Mon is an Animator/Illustrator and has graduated from LASALLE College of the Arts (Singapore) with a Diploma in Animation. He is currently working as a Character Concept Artist for both comic and animated film. As an artist, Saw enjoys illustrating outdoor backgrounds as it gives him an ideal visual of stories and characters that he would love to further develop.
Art Station: https://www.artstation.com/dear_saw/profile
Cover C - Two Identities – Vinicius Goro
Vinicius Goro is a digital artist from Brazil, currently working as an illustrator and concept artist in video games.
Art Station: https://www.artstation.com/viniciusgoro/albums/all
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/viniciusgoro/?hl=en
Cover D - Slice and Dice – PapurrCat
A small homage to Uncanny X-Men #207.
Linnéa AKA PapuurCat is a 2D artist best known for her artwork of female TV heroines that she shares to her large, loyal twitter following.
Twitter: https://twitter.com/PapurrCat
Pages from The Dancer #1 that highlight both emotion and action!

Cross Promotion
The Dusk 
Back up both The Dusk and The Dancer for a crossover print by EV Cantada.
Digital backers of both campaigns will receive a digital version of the print, and physical backers of both campaigns will receive a physical version.
And one lucky physical backer will receive the print SIGNED by both me (the writer/creator of The Dancer) and Alex (the writer/creator of Dusk)! 
Cover A - Rafi de Sousa (Interior Artist)
 Haunting #1-3
If you back both HAUNTING #1-3 and The Dancer #1 at any pledge level (even just $1!), you'll receive an EXCLUSIVE PREVIEW of an upcoming 43-page crossover one shot between Phil Falco's HAUNTING and my superhero comic Like Father, Like Daughter.
You can find out more here. Or just head straight over to the Haunting Kickstarter page!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've attempted to manage all of the risks associated with this project by doing most of the leg work before this campaign's launch so that we could ensure that we continue to deliver immediately after the campaign. As we did with our previous Kickstarters we will consistently update backers and supporters with any issues that may potentially cause delays in the completion of this project and make the necessary adjustments to resolve those matters quickly and efficiently. We understand the importance of fulfilling our promises and always ensure that all of our supporters receive their rewards. And we always find ways to sneak extra swag into our reward packages as a thank you for the patience in supporting our projects on the front end and patiently waiting for them to be completed and delivered....so we can focus on the fun part.....making comics!!! It's because of your continued support that we are able to make these AWESOME comics! And for that we truly appreciate ALL of our backers and keep a wide open form of communication for you all to reach us at any time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: HAUNTING/Like Father, Like Daughter Crossover #1 is LIVE on Kickstarter
updates.update_content:
HAUNTING/Like Father, Like Daughter Crossover #1 is LIVE on Kickstarter!
This is my newest project with my writing partner, Phil Falco, where our 2 flagship titles CROSSOVER!
Bram is a bratty teenager who just wants to be left alone. Too bad wherever he goes, THE DEAD RISE!
Casey is a high school student whose father abandoned her to become a full-time superhero. She's finally forced to grapple with her complicated feelings towards him when she !

updates.update_userinfo: Print Update + HAUNTING/Like Father, Like Daughter Crossover #1 LAUNCHES May 24th!
updates.update_content:
The comic is at the printer! Their estimated due date is 5/21. It usually takes about 2 weeks to ship - so I'm hoping to have books by the end of May/beginning of June. Once I get the books in my hands that same week I'll begin shipping and fulfilling. So we are exactly on schedule, which is great! 
The audio commentary will also be sent out in the next few weeks.
Onto some more exciting news! My writing partner (Phil Falco) and I are launching a new Kickstarter May 24th.

updates.update_userinfo: The Dancer #1 Digital Copy In Your Inbox
updates.update_content:
I'm so excited to report that the digital copy of The Dancer #1 is in your Kickstarter inbox. I can't wait to hear your thoughts on the issue. 
More stretch goal items are in your inbox as well with the first script of The Dancer #1 and A FIVE PAGE preview of the next issue. 
Audio commentary coming soon. We just put the order in for the print copies of the book. So I hope to have the books in my hand sometime this month to start shipping out.
Other Kickstarters To Back

updates.update_userinfo: Most Successful Campaign to Date - THANK YOU!!
updates.update_content:
I just wanted to take a minute and thank everyone who helped bring The Dancer #1 to life! With over 500+ backers and a five figure campaign, The Dancer is my most successful campaign to date.
In the next few weeks watch this space for updates on rewards. We are looking to wrap digital and physical fulfillment by May/June.  
Other Kickstarters To Back

We are less than 24 hours away from wrapping the campaign with all Backer Goals unlocked, but we have 1 more stretch goal we'd love to unlock. If we make it 10K before the end of the campaign every backer will receive a 5 page colored preview of The Dancer #2.

updates.update_userinfo: The Dusk Crossover Print IN COLOR
updates.update_content: We have the final version of The Dusk/The Dancer crossover print - Art By: EV Cantada and Colors By: Danny Faubricio Sànchez Chaves.

updates.update_userinfo: Third Stretch Goal Has Been Unlocked
updates.update_content:
We've officially reached $8,000!! That means all backers will receive the digital version of The Dancer #1 script. Our next stretch goal is $9,000. If we reach to this goal then every backer will receive a digital copy of my other comic book Like Father, Like Daughter #1.
"A high school girl, Casey Ryder, inherits the very powers that made her superhero father leave their family."
If you'd like the whole run thus far, there are add ons for both the digital and physical catch up of the book.

We've officially unlocked the second stretch goal - an audio commentary for the first issue, and if we reach $8,000 then ALL BACKERS will receive a digital version of The Dancer #1 script. 
Onto other news. If you enjoy Kickstarter talk. I'll be LIVE on my YouTube channel at 8 PM EST with Alex Segura of The Dusk to discuss his campaign.

project_data.project_name: The Dancer #1 - A Psychological Martial Arts Thriller

campaign.story:
This is a story about a modern day superhero.
SOLDIER focuses on Daniel Krug. He's a heroic firefighter, father of five, SWAT trainer, amateur MMA champion and armored combat enthusiast. Daniel is also a former military sniper, with combat, security, rescue and recovery experience in the middle east and Tibet. Frankly, Daniel is as close to a superhero as there is! 
But SOLDIER is about much more than him. In the past 8 years, he's lost 9 of his close friends to suicide. And that’s the reason he's partnered with me to tell his story. 
PLAY

This is a story about getting back up.
Daniel wrote this to me early on, and it's worth repeating here. "This isn’t just a story about war… or being a veteran. This is a story about suffering through trauma. This is about a world of people who silently struggle through the pain of PTSD. It’s about those of us who get up, focus our sights on the horizon… and soldier on." 
We're going to be getting into this stuff. I'll be interviewing family, friends and coworkers. We'll all be talking about loss and fortitude... straight up and honestly. And we'll be filming a lot of awesomeness! For example: one of Daniel's current pastimes featured below.
PLAY

This is a story about action.
I’ve been making award-winning films for almost 20 years, and I’ve never been more focused on a project. I have a largely volunteer team of incredible creators working with me to record all aspects of Daniels’ life, and we’ve received permission to capture some of the most amazing things you’ll ever see on film. We're talking everything from SWAT courses to one-on-one armored combat trials in a literal ring of fire.
I've also gathered - and am working with a team to professionally scan - thousands of pictures, along with archiving countless hours of old footage of Daniel's life and travels. 
Daniel's favorite photograph.
This is a story that deserves to be told. 
I've spent almost half a year building the team, outlining the 2021 schedule and shooting tests for SOLDIER... and we are ready to launch! Our budget includes everything to make the film I want to make: multiple field and interview days, storage drives for an extraordinary amount of 4K footage, archival still and video clean-up, editing, audio mixing, an original score, color correction sessions... and even an initial round of film festival submissions. It ALSO includes the 10% that goes to Kickstarter and charge fees, as well as taxes. Come join us on this adventure. We can't do it without you.
Prototype t-shirts tested for maximum softness by my kitty, Miyazaki.
Speaking of you...
I've prepared a number of reward tiers that reflect my commitment to local businesses. From hand-illustrated silkscreen t-shirts (with Endgame Clothing) to Portland printed DVD covers, post cards and poetry sheets (with StevensIS), you'll not only be backing an important film, you'll be backing family owned shops and receiving exclusive items. And as far as the t-shirts go, you'll get multiple design options. (Kitty not included.)
The team.  
Justin, Jordan and Scott. Photo by Juliana.
Justin Zimmerman: Director, Editor, Producer, Additional Camera. My personal work with www.brickerdown.com has been in over 150 film festivals worldwide, I was on the producing team of the 2014 Sundance Jury Award-winner Rat Pack Rat and my story with Spider-Gwen co-creator Robbi Rodriguez was part of the 2017 Eisner Award-winning Best Anthology Love is Love. I was the creative lead on multiple projects for Cisco Systems and Getty Images, and I'm a director at a graphic novel publishing company. As I’ve been a comic creator for a decade and a movie maker for two decades, I understand how to build an independent project from the ground up.
Jordan Eusebio: Production Sound, Dialogue Editor, Mixer. Jordan Eusebio is a Filipino-American sound designer and producer living in Corvallis, Oregon. He has over ten years of professional experience as an on-set and studio mixer. He’s worked with me on several projects over the years, on both production and post-production sides. 
Scott Ballard: Director of Photography. Scott Ballard is an award-winning Portland-based filmmaker. His credits include director of photography for nine feature films, producer of six feature films, and he’s written/directed/produced three personal feature films. He's shot multiple internationally recognized projects for me, in both documentary and narrative worlds.
Brian Sniffen: Legal Counsel. Brian has represented my work for years. His practice – Wildwood Law Group - focuses on intellectual property and business transactions, often involving obtaining, enforcing, and monetizing clients’ intellectual property rights.
And let's not forget... Brandon Reed: Producer. Torrance Maurer: Post-Production Supervisor. Matt Esteron: VFX. Juliana Patrick: Set Photographer. Ethan Claunch & Jim Choma: Art. 
Scott, Justin, Jordan and Daniel. Photo by Juliana.
Thank you.
Truly, thanks for checking out the campaign. We certainly hope you’ll consider backing and spreading the word. Stay safe out there, and wish us luck.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've delivered time-sensitive, professional projects - including right here on Kickstarter - for years. As with any major endeavor, some delays could occur. But I will be transparent throughout the course of the project and will be in regular contact, 100%.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
I'm not sure what to say, except thank you.
And the work's just begun.
I meet with the team this week, and then the next, to chart the course for the year.
This includes shoots already prepped for the next couple of weeks.

Good morning! With about 24 hours left in the campaign, I wanted to check-in and let you know where team SOLDIER is at. Well, we shot Saturday (full crew) and Sunday (running solo), and the results were simply extraordinary. It took me 6 hours to triple back up all the 4K footage from Saturday alone, which I do as soon as I get home, because I am a. methodical and b. insane. Folks, it was glorious... and we have over 2 TB of footage at the ready, and the Kickstarter hasn't even wrapped yet!
Thank you so much for supporting this project. I'm meeting with Daniel later this week to chart the course for the entire rest of the year. This now includes trips that wouldn't have been possible without your help. I can't wait for this post-Kickstarter phase to begin.

Happy Sunday!
Coming up on two weeks left in the campaign and we're still going strong. Thank you once again for joining me on this adventure. I wanted to let you know what I've been up to since we last talked... and I wanted to answer some questions I've been getting as well.
First off, I was a guest on a cool podcast and talked pretty extensively about SOLDIER. I'm usually not one to talk about process - I tend to let my 20 years of doc work speak for itself - but the questions were insightful and I was happy to chat with the two incredible hosts. Give it a listen here:

First, let's celebrate the fact that SOLDIER has met its goal. THANK YOU. I could not be here without every single one of you. Backer #115 wanted to make sure we had our minimum goal met so we could keep building on something great here, together. Basically: more shoots, more post work, more fests. And in the name of our friends at www.4WardProject.com, she's done just that. 
Second, please keep spreading the word. As technologically savvy as I may be, I'm not on Twitter, Instagram or TikTok. So, if you have a presence on any of these platforms, let the world know that is live, and funded, and worth checking out!

Hello, everyone. The support SOLDIER recieved on day 1 was inspiring. I was truly overwhelmed by the number of personal notes. I've been told that SEPTIC alone will be used by individuals in the field for years to come. If SOLDIER doesn't reach its goal - and I sure hope it does - we've already helped create real change. It's an amazing thought.

I've been asked by many folks if they should hold off on their contribution until later in the campaign. Please don't. I'd rather have a little now than a lot later. And remember, no one is charged until the campaign reaches the end - April 13th - and even then, only if it meets its goal. You can always change your amount down the road. What's important is that we have backers now, even for $1. Every. Single. Backer. Counts. Just like in real life. Keep spreading the word!

campaign.story:
Hail to the King, baby

WHAT IF JACK KIRBY CREATED DRACULA? 
The result would have been terrifying, cosmic, and absolutely epic in scale. In other words, it would be a whole lot like... 
WHAT IS THE SOLAVORE?
The Eater of Dawns
Like a vampire needs blood, so the ancient evil known as THE SOLAVORE needs the energy of a sun. Absent for centuries from the far-off galaxy of the Morrigen people, the Solavore had disappeared into the realm of myth. But now, with one of their solar systems facing a cosmic loss, the Morrigen are learning that the Solavore is not only real... but hungry.

 WHO IS HUNTING IT? 
For years, the Galactic Kingdom of the Morrigen had been protected by its latest ruler, the brave and brilliant KING THEOSIS. Committed to the freedom and safety of his people, King Theosis has lead the Morrigen through decades of darkness, striving toward a future of progress and peace. But after so many battles, Theosis's beard has gone white; the grip on his sword has grown weaker.  And after a devastating personal loss, Theosis must summon a strength he's never known to defeat the worst threat the Morrigen have ever seen.
Fortunately for Theosis, his husband ABBINOIR will be there to help. Wise and compassionate as any ruler his people have served, Abbinoir is Theosis's personal strength. While the king is looking out for the kingdom, Abbinoir looks out for its king. And though he's been doing it for all of Theosis's reign, every new threat weighs more on his mind, none more so than the Solavore. After all, how can you protect a man who must protect a kingdom?
Not that he won't have help. In facing this unheard-of crisis, Theosis will have at his command some of the best warriors in the entire galaxy: his own royal guard and the elite female warriors known as the VALKINAE. Together, they make up the best defense the Morrigen have.
But will they be enough?

SNEAK PREVIEW
Check out some of the (not finalized) pages of HUNT FOR THE SOLAVORE.
(Pages not final)
(Pages not final)
(Pages not final)
 WHO IS CREATING HUNT FOR THE SOLAVORE? 
LANE LLOYD - Creator of the weird and zany, Lane is an up and coming artist with an energetic, off the wall style. After being featured on Comic Book Yeti, Outright Geekery, and The Driving Creators Network, Lane's comic GOD-PUNCHER smashed its way onto Kickstarter, receiving more than double the projected amount of funding.  With HUNT FOR THE SOLAVORE, Lane uses their skill of designing strange, larger-than-life characters to tell a story that's both firmly planted in the horror genre and stretched to the outer limits of science fiction.
GRANT DeARMITT - Grant's tales of the sinister and strange have been published at Haw Creek Horror, Crystal Lake Publishing, and Black Hole Entertainment.  A lifelong fan of weird fiction and fantasy epics, Grant hopes HUNT FOR THE SOLAVORE will present the human side of cosmic terror; an otherworldly story that hits home.

WHY ARE THEY CREATING IT?
King Theosis's ship. For interplanetary travel... and beyond.
Lane and Grant have spent two years developing the shocking showdown of Theosis and the Solavore. They made this Kickstarter to bring that story to life in the form it deserves: the comic book format.  But there is another reason. 
HUNT FOR THE SOLAVORE is just one story of thousands set in this all-new universe that Lane and Grant have cooked up. Getting it created, printed, and into the hands of readers like yourself is the first step in telling those tales. We believe that comic fans are hungry for new worlds and new terrors, and we believe we have some great ones to offer.
So by backing this project, you're not just helping us make a comic. You're opening a door to another galaxy, and all the heroes and horrors that live there.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
It takes time and a whole lot of effort to put together a story as ambitious as HUNT FOR THE SOLAVORE, which is why we're making sure our creative team gets funding to do so! $4200 will go to Lane for his brilliant work drawing, inking, coloring, AND lettering each gorgeous and terrifying page of HFTS, while $2100 will go to Grant for his plotting, several edits, and writing of the script. We want to make sure we have everything we need to make HFTS a comic worthy of your generous support!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone! Hope your Tuesday is going well! We’re working hard on Solavore, and we hope you like what you see!
I wanted to write this update because I’ve been getting a couple emails here and there about wanting to add characters to your single character commissions. If you have purchased a single commission tier and would like to add another character, every additional character will be $25 with a limit of 5 additional characters on a single commission. If you would like your inked commission to be colored, please add an additional $25. Just note that with additions, your commission may take a little bit of time.

Hey everyone! Lane here!
Just wanted to give a little update on progress as well as send you towards another KS going on now! (Spoiler Alert, I did a print for it!)
I’ve been going through and getting quite a bit of inking done on these pages, and not to toot my own horn, but I think you’re all really going to enjoy this book! Here’s some examples! (Don’t worry, no real spoilers in these!)
Next week, I will be trying to a stream everyday to get some more inking done. Links will be provided when these happen, and I’d love for you to be there!

Twitch 
Apologies everyone, there were some technical difficulties, but the stream is back up!

Hey everyone, Sunday last week seemed like a better day to stream, so I’m doing it again today! I’m thinking noon est we’ll get the ball rolling! We’re gonna switch things up and do some early pages today!
If you go to twitch.com/lanedoodlesgood and hit the follow button, you’ll be giving a notification when the feed goes live! I’ll also be back with an update on here with a link to the show itself once it gets started.

I'll keep it brief, folks: there's a comic anthology on the dusty horizon just waiting for its time to ride. It's weird and wild, rootin' and tootin',  as gun-slingin' and fable-singin' as they come.  

And it needs YOU.
