updates.update_content:
All foreign orders were shipped on January 11, 2021. 
Please, please, PLEASE let me know if your book has arrived. 
There is literally no record/confirmation of a single delivery to any countries outside of the United States, so I have no idea who has their book who does not.

Happy New Year...and what a new year we're off to. Ugh. 
I just wanted to offer a quick update or two...
FOREIGN ORDERS will be shipped within the next 48 hours. Apologies for the delay. Let's blame Trump.
If you have filled out the reward survey and/or given me your mailing address, but have NOT received your book(s), please email me. At this point, I have sent ALL rewards to everyone who has provided an address (not including foreign orders).

Some of you have asked if there are any additional copies of the book available for sale. I have yet to send off rewards to other countries, and I still haven't sent copies to friends and family (I'm such a slacker), but once all of that is taken care of, I estimate that I'll have about 15 to 20 extra copies of the book, at which point I'll put them up for sale on my website. This will all happen some time next week.

Once again, thanks to every who has supported 2020: Hard Times in the Anarchist Jurisdiction. If your rewards have not arrived yet, hopefully they will be there soon.
My friends at Stranger Comics are in the final hours of their campaign for RUINING CHRISTMAS, which looks really fun. Please check it out.

Good news...if you're a backer and you gave me your address by Saturday, Dec. 19th, your rewards have been shipped!!! Obviously, if I don't have your address, I can't send you anything.
With a little luck, SOME may arrive before Christmas (all were sent USPS Priority.. 
All foreign orders will ship after January 1st.

The books arrived this evening (about three hours ago)!!!
And the shipment was only something like a week late...so that's exciting.
I'm packaging rewards tonight and tomorrow and it looks like I'll have everything out the door by Monday morning. Since everything is going to be shipped USPS Priority Mail, there's a chance that some books will arrive before Christmas...but I wouldn't count on it. Earlier this month I shipped some stuff Priority to the other side of town (because I'm too lazy to drive). It was supposed to take one day, but it took five. Soooooo...while I truly hope books arrive by Thursday, I wouldn't place money on it.

updates.update_userinfo: Good News and Almost Good News
updates.update_content:
Good news...the books are done.
Almost good news...the books are done but no one seems to know where the books are...but they do exist and supposedly they are "in transit."
Let's take a moment and appreciate this poetic moment that is reflective of 2020 as a whole...the printer says the books were done last week and sent via UPS. UPS confirms a shipment of twelve cases of books, weighing a collective total of 275 pounds (that's a lot of books). The problem is UPS can't tell me where the the books are at the moment, other than they MIGHT be in transit, or they MAY not have been picked up yet, but there is DEFINITELY a tracking number that can't tell me anything, so...you know...it's all good.  Now, the other good news is that this mysterious delay/confusion MAY or MAY NOT have to do with the shipping of COVID-19 vaccines, which takes priority over my books, but no one knows for sure. But since we're blaming so much on COVID-19, let's just keep on doing that.

Quick update to let everyone know what's happening...we're waiting!!!
Books are supposed to be shipping from the printer any day now (I was expecting them to be delivered by now). I have all my shipping/packing materials, and have already started printing out postage. As soon as the books arrive at my door, I will package them up and send them out priority via USPS. 
According to the USPS, if I have everything in the mail by Dec. 19th, it will arrive in time for Christmas. My hope/goal/prayer is to have all U.S. rewards in the mail by Dec. 15th (fingers crossed). I'll post another update soon.

Some of you have reported problems with filling out/submitting the reward survey. If that is the case, simply send me a direct message here on Kickstarter with your real name and your mailing address. As long as you get me your name and mailing address, I'll send you your rewards.

As a way of saying "thanks" to everyone who backed this campaign, every book will come with a bonus mini print (5.5 inches by 8.5 inches) of the poster SEASONS BLEEDINGS IN THE ANARCHIST JURISDICTION -- that means if you bought two or three books, you'll get a mini print with each. Check it out...

project_data.project_name: 2020: Hard Times in the Anarchist Jurisdiction

campaign.story:
100% FUNDED, FIRST AND SECOND STRETCH GOALS ACHIEVED AND THIRD STRETCH GOAL ANNOUNCED! SCROLL DOWN FOR MORE INFO! 

Welcome to our campaign for MURKY WATERS: Tales from Beneath; a 56 page anthology of eight short comics exploring the blurred lines separating imagination and reality.
Some of you will remember the two Kickstarter campaigns I launched in 2018 and 2019 in order to print issue one of THE RESURRECTED, and then the completed trade paperback. We were blessed to have raised approximately USD $11,000. Thank you again to all of you who supported THE RESURRECTED, even it that meant simply sharing our campaign with your friends. 
But now, it's time for MURKY WATERS!
Cover by Tula Lotay
MURKY WATERS is a full-colour 56 page anthology. The creative team hails from across the globe, making this a truly international project. All stories are complete and the electronic file is just about ready to send to the printers. The next step is to print and distribute the anthology; which is where you guys come in. With your support, we can take pre-orders and print the book soon after.
Our goal of €3,000 will cover the printing, and a chunk of the packing and shipping. Also included in this amount are the fees that Kickstarter and Amazon take for using their services, and of course, domestic taxes...
THE RESURRECTED's writing/editing/lettering team and cover artist are back!
Writer/Creator: Christian Carnouche is an Australian working at an international organisation in France. He wrote all eight stories in the anthology and is also the writer/creator of The Resurrected mini-series.  He is currently pitching his first novel (a philosophical coming of age story set in Sydney in the 1990s). 
Letterer/Designer: Cardinal Rae is an American who has lettered books such as Rose, Crowded, Bingo Love, and Superman: The Coming of the Supermen. 
Editor: Along with writing a number of popular comics, such as the Daredevil 2018 Annual,  Forgotten Home, Charmed, Twelve Devils Dancing and M3, American Erica Schultz is the editor of Bingo Love, Retail and RISE: Comics Against Bullying. Erica also participated in the first DC Comics' Writers' Workshop class taught by Scott Snyder in 2016.
Cover Artist: In addition to illustrating comics such as Supreme: Blue Rose, All Star Batman, and Bodies, Tula Lotay has drawn covers for DC, Marvel, Image, Dark Horse, Valiant and other major publishers. Tula is also the founder of the tremendously successful Thought Bubble comic convention in the UK.
The Gaze
Two page Sartrean inspired horror about a woman's refusal to let the other's gaze define her existence. Existential philosophy at its bloodiest!
Lines: Indonesian artist Ariela Kristantina (InSEXts, Mata Hari, Deep State).
Colourist: Peruvian artist Gab Contreras (Dead Beats, All We Ever Wanted).
Cogito Ergo Sum
A five page dystopian story entwining Cartesian ideas of free will, with an exploration of the complexities of the human mind and spirit.
Lines: Cogito Ergo Sum was drawn by Uruguayan Maan House (Godkillers, Devil Within). 
Colours: Indian Roshan Kurichiyanil (Giga, James Bond, Black Mumba, Six Million Dollar Man). 
The Ocean Beneath
An eight page horror/thriller about the importance of living an authentic life.
Lines: Italian artist Alex Diotto (Olympia, Youth, Southern Dog). 
Colours:  Irish artist Dearbhla Kelly (Red Sonja, Paradiso, Queen of Bad Dreams).
Darkness Neverending
A four page horror examining the age old question - what comes after death? Heaven? Hell? Something in between? Or nothing at all?
Lines: American Christian DiBari (Cutter, Hoax Hunters, Pale Horse, Toe Tag Riot).
Colours: Indonesian artist Lala Narita (Shaolin Nun, The Kingswood).
Lost River
20 page horror/thriller exploring the way in which we deal with the pain of the past and how this affects our future actions. Lost River also poses questions about the difference between a hero and villain, and examines our responsibility for the choices we made as children.  
Art: American artist J.Schiek (Death of the Horror Anthology, frequent contributor to Hyper Epics and pinup work appeared in Road of Bones trade from IDW). 

Ashes and Dust
A three page post-apocalyptic psychological horror set in the Australian desert and exploring the idea that it is through people's memories of us that we can live beyond our deaths. 
Lines: American Matthew Dow Smith (The October Girl, Deal Kings, The X-Files, Star Trek, Bad Luck Chuck). 
Colours: American Allison Hu (Transfer). 
House of Cracks
Six page story set in Tunisia and examining the power of the couple to overcome suffering and loss. 
Co-writer: Tunisian Meriam Carnouche developed the concept/characters and co-wrote the script. This is her first piece of fiction writing. 
Lines: Indian artist Devmalya Pramanik (Paradiso, Vampire: The Masquerade, Black Mumba).
Colours: Irish artist Tríona Farrell (Blackbird, West Coast Avengers, Crowded, James Bond 007, Web of Black Widow, Runaways). 
Breaking Down The Walls
A one page story touching on the ethics of imprisonment. 
Artist: 'Citizen of the World' Ismael Hernandez (The Wolf and the Crow).

 Who'll dig MURKY WATERS? 
Fans of intellectually engaging sci-fi television shows like Twilight Zone, Dark, Black Mirror and Tales from the Loop;
People who dig stories with a diverse cast of characters; 
Lovers of philosophy, or of stories with a strong philosophical message;
 Horror fans. 

Check out myself, Ariela, Dev and J, as we appear on the live streaming event with THE ICE CAST LIVE. 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jDIgZ0pssf4&t=841s

Review from Casey Douglass 
"If you like horror, sci-fi and philosophical ideas, all rolled up in striking imagery and intriguing narratives, I think you'll enjoy Murky Waters too." 

Review from Geek Vibes Nation
"With their combined creativity, they have created an anthology of diverse visuals and thought."

Review from Fanboy Factor
"Horrific, haunting, and well-handled."

THE BOOK
POSTCARD SET
This campaign we're blessed to share three pinups from my incredibly talented artist friends. These pinups will be distributed as postcards to those tiers that include the 'postcard pack.' 

'Cogito Ergo Sum' inspired pinup by Northern Irish artist Donna. A. Black 
'Darkness Neverending' inspired pinup by Scottish artist Iain Laurie

'Ashes and Dust' inspired pinup by Sri Lankan artist Sachi Ediriweera
PRODUCER EXCLUSIVE TOTE BAG
Backers of the 'Producer' tier will receive a Carnouche Productions high-quality tote bag that is exclusive to producers.
 ADDITIONAL REWARDS
In addition to the Murky Waters rewards, several tiers will offer rewards from THE RESURRECTED campaigns, including the trade paperback (cover by Tula Lotay), single issues and pinups. 


REWARD TIERS 

 FIRST STRETCH GOAL ACHIEVED!
We've smashed our first first stretch goal - ALL physical backers will receive an exclusive art print from Lucy Sullivan if we hit 4000 euros! Digital tier backers will receive a digital version of the print. I'm not sure what drawing Lucy has up her sleeve yet, but I'm 100% certain it will be something special :)
Lucy is from the UK and is the writer/artist of the smash-hit graphic novel 'Barking.' Not only is Barking an incredible piece of work, but it's themes and atmosphere tie in closely with those of Murky Waters. I absolutely recommend you read it. Lucy is also the artist on the upcoming comic IND-XED (with Fraser Campbell - a sincerely brilliant writer - check out his comics here - https://alexautomaticblog.wordpress.com/) and is currently drawing a short story for the hit anthology series Razorblades.
Check out some of Lucy' work here - https://lucysullivanuk.com/
And some samples of her work: 
SECOND STRETCH GOAL ACHIEVED!
We've hit 5000 euros, so all physical backers will receive a Carnouche Productions fridge magnet! 
THIRD STRETCH GOAL ANNOUNCED!
We're now aiming for our third stretch goal of €6000, which is that all physical backers will receive a mini-print of Tula Lotay's stunning Murky Waters cover. Digital backers will receive a digital version. I've had several people mention they'd like Tula's cover as a poster and I really can't disagree.
IMPORTANT NOTE ON ORDERING ADDITIONAL REWARDS
Once the Kickstarter is finished, all backers will be sent email surveys to confirm what they ordered. YOU MUST FILL OUT THE SURVEY TO RECEIVE YOUR REWARDS.
We will also be using 'backerkit,' which will allow you to add rewards to your initial order, even after the Kickstarter campaign has finished. If you do choose to add to your order, postage costs may increase based on the parcel weight.
Yet again, we will be using high-quality offset printing to produce our books. PrintNinja  were fantastic last campaign, but this time we'll be using a printer closer to home -Pulsio Print.

Thanks and see you all on the other side!


Music for the introduction video:
Supernatural by Kevin MacLeod
License: http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The art is 99% complete so there will be no delays in this regard.

The most significant obstacle we've identified is the potential cost of international shipping. The creators and our supporters are based all around the world - including the U.S, Australia, Europe, Asia, and South America. 

Last campaign I used a fulfilment centre to send out all of the packages in order to cut down postage costs for you guys. This time though, I will be personally shipping rewards, which will be sent in Amazon type cardboard mailers.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Check out Erica Schultz's 'The Deadliest Bouquet' Kickstarter!
updates.update_content:
Hi guys, 
Quick message just to give you a heads up that my editor and friend Erica Schultz is running a Kickstarter campaign for her series "The Deadliest Bouquet."
I've read the first issue and it's an absolute beauty. Well worth your hard earned cash. 
Check it out here: 
THE DEADLIEST BOUQUET
Quick update to let you guys know that the books have arrived and have already been shipped!  They are bloody beautiful and I can't wait to get them into your hands!

Hope everyone had a relaxing holiday. 2020 is finally bloody behind us. 
A few quick updates to share. 
Firstly, and most importantly, the PDF version of the anthology is ready to share with backers, and has already been sent to the printer. We're way ahead of schedule so far. 
You should all have received your surveys from Backerkit by now. If not, please check your spam. There are still a few stragglers so please try to fill the survey out asap so I can send out the PDF version of the copy. And for backers of the physical tiers, you need to fill out the surveys so Backerkit can record your shipping addresses. Please let me know if you haven't received the survey.

updates.update_userinfo: Backerkit surveys sent/Lucy Sullivan's pinup complete!
updates.update_content:
Hello backers!
As of last night Backerkit should have sent you all reward surveys. They are super easy to fill out, which is lucky because you need to complete them in order to receive your rewards! Thanks to all who have already filled them out. 
The comic is actually now 100% complete and ready to send to the printer. I'll send out the digital rewards once the surveys are completed.

updates.update_userinfo: FULLY FUNDED! So what happens next?
updates.update_content:
Well we finally did it! We ended up with €5637 from 193 backers, which smashed my previous record of €5132 from 142 backers. Although my official target was €3000, the truth was that I was really hoping for around €5000; so things went perfectly in that respect :)  And all because of you awesome backers! It's been an exciting and nervous month and I'm extremely relieved it all worked out as well as it did. The majority of Kickstarters are unsuccessful so you never know how these things will go....
There's still a lot of work to do though.  Firstly, Kickstarter will charge your credit card (this process has begun). Not long after, you will receive your reward surveys to fill out. To receive your rewards  Sorry for screaming but it's very important... I'm using to coordinate everything and they will be sending you surveys soon so keep a look out for an email from them. The surveys are very simple to fill out and you'll actually be able to add on any items that you missed out on.

updates.update_userinfo: 45 hours to go! Second stretch goal achieved and third one unlocked!
updates.update_content:
Hello backers!
We've hit the final stretch and we're 172% funded with 45 hours remaining. Not only did we smash the second stretch goal this morning, but we've hammered my previous funding and backer records. All thanks to you! 
We're now aiming for our third stretch goal of €6000, which is that all physical backers will receive a mini-print of Tula Lotay's stunning Murky Waters cover. Digital backers will receive a digital version. I've had several people mention they'd like Tula's cover as a poster and I really can't disagree.

updates.update_userinfo: Massive thank you to the backers of the 'Producer' reward tier!
updates.update_content:
Blown away today to receive our fifth pledge to the producer level tier of Murky Waters! 
Not only will these backers be named in the credits as producers in the physical and digital versions of the anthology, but they will receive an exclusive producer tote bag, four copies of the anthology, The Resurrected trade paperback and loads of other Carnouche Productions merchandise. Not to mention my everlasting appreciation of your generosity. Times are tough for people right now, so I'm even more honoured than usual that you chose to help produce our project :)

If we hit 5000 euros, all physical backers will receive a Carnouche Productions fridge magnet. That's in addition to the Lucy Sullivan art print that backers will receive from the first stretch goal. 
The skull for the logo was designed by my good mate, and world-famous graffiti artist 'Dmote.' Check his work out here - Dmote. 
Hopefully we can smash this stretch goal the same way we did the last one.

updates.update_userinfo: FIRST STRETCH GOAL SMASHED - LUCY SULLIVAN PRINT FOR ALL PHYSICAL BACKERS!
updates.update_content:
We've well and truly smashed our first stretch goal with one week to go! 
Every backer of a physical tier will now receive a wonderful art print from Lucy Sullivan, the writer/artist of the smash-hit graphic novel 'Barking.' All digital backers will receive a digital version of the print, but of course they are still able upgrade their digital tiers to physical ones.
I'll announce the second stretch goal shortly.

campaign.story:
Foundlings is a brand new dystopian young adult comic book series co-created by John Stanisci (Batman Beyond) and Emma Kubert (Inkblot, Image Comics) in the vein of Stranger Things and The Goonies, tackling issues of diversability and empowerment. The series follows a group of children cast aside by their families and society…until they were possibly the only ones capable of saving it.
Standard Kickstarter Edition Cover by Emma Kubert
Variant Cover by Emma Kubert
Special Limited Bleeding Cool Variant Cover by Emma Kubert
Years in the future, a virus has been weaponized by a Russian government hell-bent on destroying America from within. This deadly new strain has been perfected to kill within 24 hours of contact, and only small groups of children carry an immunity to the effects. They are the Foundlings; a diverse group of children under the age of 16, who alone carry the hope for a possible cure, and a solution to extinction.
Foundlings centers around one very special group of kids, all who still dream of the families that long ago abandoned them, and instead find family in each other in order to survive and find a way to save the Earth from destruction. The story is inspired by The Foundlings Hospital in New York City, which is a real-life home to children, many of whom are challenged with physical and emotional issues. The story is rich with themes of empowerment and inspiration for teenagers and adults alike, in a fun adventure story that recalls some of the most beloved films and television series.
John Stanisci is a New York Times best selling artist and writer for DC, Marvel and IDW Comics having drawn such characters as Spider-Man, Batman, Constantine, Justice League Dark, Judge Dredd,  X Files and many more. In 2011, John's book for DC Comics, Batman Beyond: Hush Beyond, premiered at #1 on the New York Times bestseller list for graphic novels. John’s original graphic novel, Lifedeath, received a major announcement in The Hollywood Reporter and is under development for film/tv. John’s published work has appeared throughout the world in many countries including Germany, England, France and others. John is also a Broadway/Off Broadway playwright, actor and producer. John’s original plays have been named as finalists for the prestigious Woodward/Newman Award for drama as well as the Eugene O’Neil Playwrights Conference and others. www.johnstanisci.com
Emma Kubert is a freelance comic book artist, writer and graduate of the Kubert School (2018). She has freelanced for various companies such as DC Entertainment, Dynamite Entertainment, 20th Century Fox, and Image Comics. Emma recently penciled, inked and colored for DC Entertainments’ DC SUPERHERO GIRLS and TEEN TITANS GO!, and drew layouts for the company’s young adult graphic novel RAVEN. She is currently working on her Image Comics’ creator-owned series INKBLOT with Rusty Gladd and developing sci-fi fantasy FOUNDLINGS with John Stanisci.
Additional Credits:
Lettering: Rusty Gladd
Design: Jason Ullmeyer
Video: Olivia Oguma
We decided to go direct to Kickstarter comics supporters because we have seen such a strong statement from this platform’s users in favor of diverse content from both well-known and up and coming creators. We see the opportunity to make the case for Foundlings to see publication as a full graphic novel, and eventual graphic novel series with the community we can create here. We also needed to help pay for the continued development and creation of this story in lieu of other paid work for hire comics work. We have plans for not only the Foundlings graphic novel, but possibly developing this story to other media and you will help us shape those decisions, and have an exclusive window into the process and the journey of Foundlings.
The story of Foundlings is inspired by the idea that heroes aren’t always the people we might expect, and must rise above their own struggles to meet the challenge presented to them. In that same spirit, you can be the co-founders of tomorrow’s pop culture. By backing Foundlings, you not only support the creation of this independent comic book, you help us send a message to the industry that you want more stories that explore heroes of all kinds and their journeys of trial and triumph. Everyone deserves to find themselves in their favorite stories to get lost in.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The entire team behind the project are accomplished comic book professionals with great reputations and in some cases, a long track record of success. Foundlings #1 will be fully inked, lettered and colored by Emma Kubert and Inkblot partner Rusty Gladd. Our challenges will relate primarily to ensuring that all rewards are delivered quickly and at the lowest possible rates. We will be using a fulfillment company to ensure that the process runs smoothly. We also will be fully transparent and communicative with our community should any unforeseen delays occur.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey everyone!
First of all, we wanted to thank you all for your patience in the face of printing delays, and of course our BackerKit survey issues. If there is anyone who has not received a survey, please let me know directly (jeremy@punkhouseproductions.com), as we still have a few outstanding and we want to get your books to you! Speaking of, books are shipping now and we are getting closer and closer to having a partner to help us publish the rest of the first story arc. We should have more info on this soon, as we close in on some of the publishers we have been speaking to, but will make sure that YOU hear this news first.

updates.update_userinfo: Updates on printing, shipping, and a Foundlings series!

updates.update_content:
FIrst of all, thank you all so much for both your support and today, your patience. While all of us involved in Foundlings have run Kickstarters before and worked in various roles in comics publishing, every journey is full of surprises, and this one is no exception. 
We are thrilled to tell you that Foundlings is on its way to print this week, and we are working with a printer specializing in tight turnaround times to get all rewards to you as close to on time as hoped, with maybe a few exceptions.

updates.update_userinfo: Variant cover revealed, new tiers announced!
updates.update_content: Thank you all so much for your support thus far! We are incredibly grateful for the past two weeks and all of those who have donated already. We are getting closer and closer to our initial goal, with some exciting stretch goals planned, including creating further issues in the series. With that goal firmly in our sights, today we reveal our exclusive Kickstarter variant cover, as well as an extremely limited alternate version in conjunction with the influential comic book news site, Bleeding Cool! For those who have already contributed, this special Bleeding Cool variant is available as a $20 add on for the next seven days ONLY. Both variants are below, and we hope you agree, these were well worth the wait!

project_data.project_name: Foundlings: A new comic from John Stanisci and Emma Kubert

campaign.story:
The last dragon prince has been abducted and is kept prisoner by an unknown threat: AZTEC MEXICA. Helm Greycastle and his band of outsider adventures are tasked with exploring the uncharted land that was once at the brink of enslavement by the savage Spanish Conquistadors...but the Aztecs used sorcery to thwart the Conquistador's murderous rampage. The possible enslavement caused the ruler, Montezuma III, to declare himself the dictator of MEXICA causing a power shift and class division. Greycastle and his comrades are recruited by an underground group lead to overthrow Montezuma III and the Gods that suppress the land.  Will Greycastle join the resistance or save the dragon prince and flee?
THE COMIC
The first issue will be 32 pages filled with sequential story art and a one-shot role-playing game that is compatible with the fifth edition Dungeons and Dragons Player's Handbook. The RPG will take place in the fictional Mesoamerican world set in HELM GREYCASTLE, so it's not necessary to play games to know what's going on in the story.
COVERS & VARIANTS
KICKSTARTER VARIANT: Matthew Emmons
COVER A: Rahmat M. Handoko
COVER B: David Lapham
COVER C: MYSTERY ARTIST
REWARDS
In addition to the HELM GREYCASTLE #1 Kickstarter variant, I'm offering some cool rewards!
(7) AZTEC GOLD colored RPG Nickel Plated Dice dice in collaboration with Yesterdays Co. *Not real Aztec Gold.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Helm Greycastle is not a known comic book property by established comic book creators. It is a major risk to release a brand new original property in 2020. The goal is to pay the numerous creative professionals living wages that are already working various freelancing opportunities. The money raised will not only go to paying for the art, printing, and distribution of the comic but also the rewards to incentivize backers to support. 
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Thanks for your patience! 
I hate to make excuses. But I've been working day and night. I'm not curing cancer or anything life-changing.  But making comics is not easy when you have to pay rent. Thankfully, I've shipped 300+ packages! I have less than one hundred to go, so for those of you that haven't got your rewards. They're coming!

I can't thank all of you enough for your help. 
I'm so grateful to everyone involved: Bryan, Rahmat, Tristan, Gabriela, Jen, Lapham, Matt, Claire, Becky, Sasha, Yesterdays Co., and Cheyenne.
Now the pressure is on.
I do my best to not spam folks with updates and newsletters, so please let me know if you have any questions or concerns. You should be getting your reward surveys, so please fill those out before March 2021.

updates.update_userinfo: Helm is going to the printer 4.6.2021!
updates.update_content:
Thank you so much for making this my most successful personal campaign. I know we've all suffered hardships, reduced income, and have been isolated from the rest of the world. I know it's pretty grim out there, but you have made my 2020 not a complete loss. So for that, I thank you!
If you would like to add the new Becky Cloonan cover to your pledge, here's how I would suggest doing that:

campaign.story:
THE CATCH is a 3-issue comic book mini-series written and lettered by Steve Bryant, with art by Ismael Canales, colors by Mireia Girbau, and edited by Chris Murrin—the first of many mini-series. If you backed our previous campaign, thank you very much! We’re incredibly thankful to our Kickstarter community and we're going to do our best to pack each campaign with as many cool exclusives as we can for you. If you’re new to the book, thanks for checking us out!
This campaign is to raise funds to print issue #3 and hopefully hit a couple of Stretch Goals. (We have some exciting ones lined up that we’re dying to tell you about.) If you were with us for issues 1 and 2, the story continues here. If you're new to THE CATCH, both issues are available in this campaign, and here's a quick overview ...
When super-villains like Galactoid, Dron the Conqueror, or Professor Kill are defeated, they're sent to a government maximum security facility. But what about small-timers like Phileas Frost, The Grappler, or the random jump-suited agents of H.A.R.M.? What happens to the bank robbers, jewel thieves, and anonymous henchmen?
They post bail.
And sometimes, they skip town afterward. That's where Lucy Chase comes in.
Lucy comes from a family of law enforcement folks, but spends her days working for bail bondsman Leon Tilman, chasing down costumed criminals who jump bail. Keeping super-powered lowlifes in line is a dangerous job; especially when you don't have super-powers yourself. Bounty hunters who specialize in supers are few and far between, keeping Lucy in high demand.
Deputy U.S. Marshal Jack Devlin is Lucy’s on-again, off-again love interest. Jack’s assigned to the Federal Powered and Supernatural Crimes Joint Task Force, but he sometimes provides unofficial backup when Lucy has a bounty.
So far, Lucy and Jack have crossed paths with some colorful folks who are very interested in their activities.
 And now everyone—criminals, the authorities, and Lucy & Jack—are all on a collision course.
Money raised will go toward artist and colorist fees, printing, backer rewards, and shipping. If we're lucky enough to exceed our goal, all additional funding will be put directly back into the book in the form of additional rewards and production of the next issue.
In English...
And in Español (digital)…
Main cover by Ismael Canales and Mireia Girbau.
Variant Cover by Steve Bryant and Jason Millet.
"Movie Poster" Variant Cover by Ismael Canales and Jason Millet.
We have a wide variety of rewards lined up, from digital comics, to physical comics and variant covers, to "Catch-Up" combos that  bring new readers up to speed, to Collector Boxes, to original art, and more!
If you support a Kickstarter campaign, the last thing you want is for your books to arrive damaged! With that in mind, all of our physical packages are being shipped in Gemini Comic Mailers. These things are practically nuke-proof, insuring that your comics arrive in great condition!
The only physical reward levels that won't come in these mailers are the Collector Boxes which are wrapped in bubble-wrap and shipped in Priority Mail medium boxes, and the original art & "Draw Me In" rewards, which are shipped flat between multiple sheets of corrugated cardboard, insuring no bending.
• Fans of super-hero crime comics, like Gotham Central, Jessica Jones/Alias, or Powers.
• People who like heist or caper movies, or TV shows like Justified or Better Call Saul.
• Indie comic collectors looking to get in on the ground floor of a new book, filled with action, clever dialogue, and great visuals.
The Catch #3 is a 32-page standard-sized American comic, printed on high-quality paper.
The extra-sized first and second issues include 24 sequential pages of action, along with some great concept art.
All backers will also receive TWO digital versions of issue 3: digital versions in English and Español, as well as being listed in the digital edition of issue 3.
Stretch Goals! If we exceed our funding target, these stretch goals are milestones where you, the backers, get even more stuff!
Stretch Goal #1 ($9,000) Stick Around!
Stretch Goal #2 ($11,000) Keep In Touch! 
Stretch Goal #3 ($13,000) An Irresistible Attraction!
Stretch Goal #4 ($15,000) Mystery Stretch Goal!
Backer Goals! As more people back The Catch #3, we'd like to reward you with  additional incentives to reach our funding goal. If we reach our goal, and have the listed numbers of backers below, we'll add on even more stuff for you!
100 Backers: Audio Commentary! 
200 Backers: Digital "Director's Cut!": The scripts for issues 1 and 2, as well as Ismael's black-and-white art for each page will be included in super-sized digital director's cuts of issues 1 and 2!
250 Backers: Super-sized Digital "Director's Cut!": Super-supersized versions of the director's cuts will include all of Roger and Mireia's unlettered color pages, as well!
300 Backers: Digital edition of Athena Voltaire and the Volcano Goddess: 80 pages of action and adventure starring Steve Bryant's butt-kickin' 1930s aviatrix as she takes on Nazis and occult horrors!
STEVE BRYANT (writer/letterer/variant cover artist)  Steve Bryant is the Eisner, Manning, and Harvey Award-nominated writer/artist of Athena Voltaire from  Action Lab Entertainment, and the writer/co-creator of Ghoul Scouts, also published by Action Lab. He has also completed projects for Dark  Horse Comics, IDW, Boom! Studios, Ape Entertainment, and others, as well  as extensive work in the roleplaying game industry.
ISMAEL CANALES (artist)  Ismael Canales was born in 1980 in La Roda,  a small town from Spain; he was graduated in Fine Arts in the  Politechnique University of Valencia, majored in Drawing and Animation.  He has completed work for Spanish horror anthologies and magazines, as  well as comics for U.S. publishers ECV Press and Action Lab  Entertainment. He lives with his girlfriend in his hometown and still  wears geek t-shirts.
MIREIA GIRBAU (colorist)  Mireia Girbau was born in 1996 in Sabadell, a city near Barcelona (Spain). She was graduated in Illustration in Escola Illa and Graphic Arts in Escola Joso. Since 2018, she has designed book covers, board games, and worked in comic book projects for Planeta Comic, Paper de Ceba and El Huevo Eterno. She's currently illustrating a deck-building card game, Last Forest, and loves playing roleplaying games all the time.
CHRIS MURRIN (editor)  Chris  Murrin has been writing and editing comics and prose for over  fifteen  years. In addition to working with Steve Bryant on both Athena Voltaire and Ghoul Scouts  for Action Lab, Chris edits numerous titles for both Arch Blue and  LawDog Comics. When he’s not pestering authors with his notes, Chris  works with the marketing team at FX Networks, editing promos for both  movie presentations and shows such as Archer, It’s Always Sunny in Philadelphia,  The Simpsons, and You’re the Worst. You’ve probably seen his work go by in a pixelated blur on your DVR.
"THE CATCH is the kind of gleeful, clever deconstruction of a genre that can only be pulled off by creators who secretly love it. The freshest take on super-heroes and super-villains in the "real world" since POWERS. I'm mad I didn't think of it myself!" – Phil Hester, cartoonist
“THE CATCH is a superhero crime caper that blends the best of both genres to create something wholly new, engaging and memorable. Bryant, Canales, Surroca, and Murrin expertly weave a story that evokes greats like Elmore Leonard, Greg Rucka and Ed Brubaker without feeling like a carbon copy. As someone who enjoys all things noir and super-powered, THE CATCH is a perfect match.” - Alex Segura, acclaimed author of BLACKOUT
“THE CATCH is a great looking book with a fun premise. The team of Bryant, Canales, Surroca, and Murrin have a winner on their hands.” – Jamal Igle, co-creator of THE WRONG EARTH from Ahoy Comics.
“A little bit sci-fi, a little bit superhero, and a little bit good-natured procedural on top of it all, THE CATCH is such an obvious idea, I'm mad I didn't come up with it myself! Engaging, fun, and with a ton of potential -- you're gonna like spending time with Lucy Chase.” – Erik Burnham, IDW’s GHOSTBUSTERS
"Lucy Chase is a new era Karen Sisco in this action-packed and thrilling take on bounty hunting super-villains. Full of finesse and suspense, you won't be disappointed reading THE CATCH!" – Shawn Pryor, CASH + CARRIE
“THE CATCH is a fun, sexy caper in the style of 70s classics like THE THOMAS CROWN AFFAIR. Sleek and slick.” – Wendi Freeman, DOUBLE PAGE SPREAD
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every Kickstarter campaign comes with risks and unforeseen issues. With that in mind we're applying lessons learned from past campaigns. 

We're committed to delivering the best possible experience to our backers, so we're investing in top-of-the-line shipping materials, and handling fulfillment 100% in-house. This will eliminate the risk of delivery delays and to make sure your pledges arrive in great condition. Most importantly, I'll address every question personally. The buck stops here.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi, everyone!
Thanks, as always, for supporting The Catch. And thanks for your patience while getting this one out the door: from deadline/scheduling issues on the production of the book, to a death in the family, to colliding with an immovable other deadline,  and implementing a new shipping solution, this one was a handful.
Sometimes, completing a Kickstarter is like defeating the Borg on Star Trek: it can't be done the same way twice.

Hi, everyone!
These arrived yesterday afternoon!

updates.update_userinfo: Look what landed on my doorstep!
updates.update_content:
Hi, everyone!
I apologize for the radio silence. As I believe I mentioned in a previous update, my mom passed away in early January. My dad passed in 2007, but with both parents gone, there ended up being a lot more estate-related stuff for my brother and me to close out this time. I hadn't anticipated that.
It was compounded by my decision to run the Athena Voltaire and the Terror on the Orient Express campaign in late January. I felt the need to hold firm to my plan to run the campaign at that time, in the event that San Diego Comic-Con would take place this year. Having books, particularly one "new to the con," is key in covering the cost of a trip to a convention like that. Of course, within a week of the campaign wrapping up, SDCC cancelled their July show.

updates.update_userinfo: Books are off to the printer!
updates.update_content:
Hi, everyone!
I checked in with Ismael earlier today. He's had a rush job in the queue, but will be tackling the last page of this issue this week. "Last page?" I can hear you say. "I thought the issue was already drawn when the campaign launched." It was...except for the page with the Draw Me In Reward. He'll wrap up those cameos and we'll be sending the book to print shortly thereafter.

Hi, everyone!
Thanks again for your patience. Due to my mom's passing, I haven't posted as many updates as I'd like, and your understanding was really helpful.
My schedule is settling down. As I type this, I'm waiting for Habitat for Humanity to come by her home and pick up the furniture items that weren't claimed by family members. I should be finishing all of this up by the end of the week.

updates.update_userinfo: Off to the printer next week!
updates.update_content:
Hi, everyone--
Thanks again for backing The Catch. 
I apologize for the radio silence. A couple of weeks ago, my mom went into hospice care. I've been working away at my day job, teaching, and helping take care of her affairs/funeral prep. However, I've been an awful communicator to you all.

Hi, everyone!
Another one in the books! That's three issues of The Catch that we've put on Kickstarter, and three successful campaigns. Thank you all so much!
I think I mentioned that Ismael has this issue drawn already, so on Monday, Mireia will start coloring the remaining pages. It's my goal to ship this in January, but with the holidays, it may bleed into February.

updates.update_userinfo: Wow! Three Up and Three Down!
updates.update_content:
Hey, everyone!
Thanks again for backing The Catch. I meant to post an update this morning, but I had to take my mom in for a COVID test (nothing to worry about; she's 89 and is scheduled for an upper GI procedure on MOnday, and they require a test three days prior). 
The last 30 days have gone by so quickly! I hope we can reach the next Backer Goal—I'd love to share some Athena Voltaire with you, for those of you who aren't familiar with my main series.

campaign.story:
The First Ever Hack/Slash Kickstarter is Here! The world's favorite slasher hunter returns with BIG HACK ENERGY 
Coming in at a 432 pages and 7.5"W x 11"H format, this collection packs more punch than than a Crystal Lake campground killer.
Featuring an ALL NEW short story written and drawn by the Cassie Hack creator himself, Tim Seeley! 
If you happen to be one of the only fuckers in the world who haven't heard of Hack/Slash, what are you waiting for? Slash your way on down this page and find a synopsis below!
HACK/SLASH Omnibus Hardcover featuring a VHS inspired cover by Tim Seeley!
BIG HACK ENERGY collects all of the early volumes and issues of the Hack/Slash comic book series included in the paperback Omnibus. vol. 1, but now bigger and badder, with the exclusive short story.





Add on the VINTAGE HORROR HOTEL KEY CHAIN to any pledge for $10!


The HACK/SLASH Omnibus Hardcover collects:
EUTHANIZED
GIRLS GONE DEAD
COMIC BOOK CARNAGE
LAND OF LOST TOYS #1-3
TRAILERS
 SLICE HARD Prequel 
SLICE HARD
 CHUCKY Crossover 
EVIL ERNIE Crossover
 But that's not all! What would a kickstarter campaign be without a bunch of sick rewards to go along with it? That's why we've added pins, shirts (featuring the OG classic Hack/Slash logo), and masks for protecting your face from the putrid funk spewing from the mouths of your undead assailants... or, like, viruses or whatever. 
2 cover options! Stefano Caselli cover available only here!
BIG HACK ENERGY! Pages are 15% larger than the average graphic novel - A whopping 7.5" x 11"! This fucker's gonna be HUGE.


 Sneak Peek of the original short by Tim Seeley (colors by Triona Farrel)
From the new short story!
Print set includes all 4 prints!

Includes an 11" x 17" print of your choice (options above)!
Comes with all three 11" x 17" prints!

 Other Pages Included: 
What the Hell is Hack and Slash? I mean "Hack Slash"
At the end of every horror movie, one girl always survives... in this case, Cassie Hack not only survives, she turns the tables by hunting and destroying the horrible slashers that would do harm to the innocent! Alongside the gentle giant known as Vlad, the two cut a bloody path through those who deserve to be put down... hard!
Created in 2004, Hack/Slash has now corrupted the minds of thousands upon thousands of readers, horror fans, aspiring comic book creators, cosplayers, and people just looking for a good time, but it has NEVER been presented in a prestige format like the BIG HACK ENERGY edition. 
As for Comic Shops - YES this will be getting a release from Image Comics. 
 “Why Kickstarter?" 
Are people still asking "Why Kickstarter?" Just in case, here’s the basic rundown. Sure, this comic has built up this huge cult following over the years, but it still takes a lot to put it together, it all has to come out of the creator’s pocket up front, and even with all of the love we get from fans, it’s still an indie comic. So when it comes to doing something really big like this hardcover edition (like, literally, it’s a really big book), it only made sense to come to Kickstarter to help make it happen. The other reason is why wouldn’t we? This has become such an amazing community for cultivating independent comics, and a place to find our most hardcore fans with something beyond social media. Plus, we get to offer some really fun extra perks that wouldn’t be possible to do otherwise.
Will This Book Be Available Through Stores?
You bet! Like all of the other Hack/Slash comics, this will be available from the one and only Image Comics some time early next year. BUT... it will not include a lot of the cool unique swag you can get here, nor the signed book plates from Tim Seeley himself. We also may be adding some fancy glossy accents to the cover depending on what we decide to do with stretch goals. 
By supporting this kickstarter you help us get this book done so that the stores CAN have it. You're actively playing a part in making it a reality, whereas without you, it likely just wouldn't happen. You may receive it before the stores, or slightly after, because it takes time to sign everything and pack and ship. That's not the point of the campaign. If it's SUPER important to you to get it ASAP, though, we understand, in which case please place pre-orders at your local comic shop or book store.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While everything in this campaign is set to move forward very quickly after the campaign ends, we understand that circumstances out of our control may happen. It is always possible that printing and manufacturing delays can happen, product can get lost in the shipping process, global pandemics, currency collapse, alien invasions, robot rebellion, or human error may cause something to not be sent. That's why we've worked so hard to create an iron-clad system to cater to Kickstarter backers. We use the latest state of the art software along with an awesome warehouse team to track everything. We're in this for the long haul, and want you back for many more in the future, and that only happens if you're happy with how this one goes!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Earlier this week, HACK/SLASH Omnbus Kickstarter rewards started to leave the warehouse and make their way to your door!
Some of you may have already received your reward! For those who haven't received their reward yet, we cannot freakin' wait until they do arrive. Tracking for the packages that have gone out so far will be posted to BackerKit tonight.
Again, we cannot thank you guys enough for helping make the first ever HACK/SLASH Kickstarter a huge success and thank you for all your support.

updates.update_userinfo: International Shipping update and a reminder to pledge for God Hates Astronauts!
updates.update_content:
Just a short & sweet update...
Some of you may have already received an email from BackerKit and already know, but for those who haven't checked their inbox yet - we finally have tracking for international rewards and they are en route to leave the States!
To our international backers, we are really sorry about the delay. We definitely did not expect this to happen and we truly appreciate your patience. Thank you so much for bearing with us.

updates.update_userinfo: SUBJECT: AR HACK/SLASH Cover by Matt Waite! Shipping Update!
updates.update_content:
Happy Friday!
First of all, we just want to say thank you again for making the first ever HACK/SLASH Kickstarter effing amazing. Tim Seeley and HACK/SLASH, Inc. can't thank you guys enough for making every part of this project possible.
The warehouse has informed us that almost all rewards shipping to the US have gone out and that international shipping is still in the works. We're still waiting on confirmation that the first batch of international rewards have been picked up. Crossing our fingers that they're leaving the warehouse as we speak.

updates.update_userinfo: HACK/SLASH in stores today! Kickstarter rewards are shipping soon!
updates.update_content:
Happy Hump Day and Happy Pub Day! The standard edition of the  HACK/SLASH Omnibus Hardcover is now available at a comic shop near you. Heck, yeah!
While the book hits stores, the warehouse is double and triple checking that they have everything they need to securely pack your Kickstarter rewards. As excited as we are to get these beauties delivered to your door, we don't want to rush the packing process. We want everything to arrive in pristine condition. As soon as we get word that the first batch of rewards have gone out the door, we'll post another update.

The office copy of the HACK/SLASH Omnibus 1 Hardcover has been delivered!
Some of you may have already seen the pics on Twitter, but for those who haven't - feast your eyes on this beauty...

updates.update_userinfo: We're off to press! HACK/SLASH Omnibus PDFs sent to you via BackerKit!
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone!
We're happy to announce that this BIG, BEAUTIFUL BI — we mean, uh, book has been released for press! We are so excited to see the printed and bound HACK/SLASH Omnibus Hardcover and we're even more excited to get them in your hands.
Until then, the PDF version of the hardcover has been sent to backers who pledged for the digital reward or physical copy of the book. You'll get an email from BackerKit with instructions on how to download the PDF along with the password to access it. If you run into any issues or can't find the email in your inbox*, please DM us.

updates.update_userinfo: Tim has 1000 Blood Splattered Bookplates to Sign!
updates.update_content:
HACK/SLASH creator Tim Seeley is currently in the process of signing 1000 bloody bookplates (with some help from little baby Seeley).
Yep, you read that right: ONE THOUSAND bookplates. Some bookplates might have pink crayon on them and we apologize in advance. But, Tim's gonna need all the help he can get!

updates.update_userinfo: Backers Only Update - Coloring Book Download!
updates.update_content:
Happy Monday! 
Out of all the Mondays in the year, this Monday seems to have the least cases of the 'Mondays'. For some this marks the beginning  of cozying up for the holidays and for others, today is the beginning of a 2 week long bender into the New Year. 
No matter how you celebrate, Happy Holidays from the Seeleys and HACK/SLASH, Inc!

updates.update_userinfo: Happy Holidays from the Seeleys! BackerKit Closes Today!

Happy Friday!
As the world begins to hunker and wind down for the holidays and well, you know, the second wave - don't forget to complete your BackerKit survey!
